name: Road Corridor Manager
description:
Tauranga is New Zealand's fastest growing and fifth largest city. Managing this growth makes for a challenging and dynamic work environment. Tauranga City Council is focused on the City's future and responding to the changing needs of the community. We want to work with our community to successfully plan for and understand their needs and expectations.

At Tauranga City Council we are responsible for managing activities on the roading network to ensure safe, efficient and reliable journeys to customers across the Bay of Plenty region. The Road Corridor Manager plays a crucial role by reviewing and approving corridor access requests which means dealing with developers, contractors, consultants, utility operators, event organisers and the general public on a daily basis. The Road Corridor Manager has a finger on the pulse of everything that's going on in Tauranga and no two days are the same.

We are looking for an exceptional Road Corridor Manager to join our team, reporting to the Team Leader: Corridor Access & Temporary Traffic Management. Ensuring worker and public safety, managing the impact to all modes of transport and providing a top level of customer service whilst maintaining a professional attitude at all times. This is an exciting opportunity for an organised, self-motivated individual to make a positive impact on the community. The successful applicant will be confident working in a high performing team building relationships both internally and externally while being a subject matter expert in traffic management and activities in the road reserve.

For this role, you will ideally have;

  • A Temporary Traffic Management qualification STMS Level 2/3 (NP)
  • Minimum of three years' experience in a traffic management, roading, utilities or similar role, preferably working with or alongside Local Government or NZTA.
  • Exposure to relevant legislations and regulations such as Health & Safety at Work Act 2015, Utilities Act 2010 and the Code of Practice for Temporary Traffic Management (CoPTTM).
  • Well-developed problem solving skills and a commitment to continuous improvement
  • Sound organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritise tasks
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Digitally savvy, particularly in the Microsoft Office suite.

At Tauranga City Council, we believe in supporting our talent and we offer a range of learning and development opportunities and flexible working conditions to help you achieve the most from your career.

If you're looking for a career where you can make a real difference, then we would love to hear from you and have you join our team!

Applications close Friday 23 October 2020.

name: Oracle Apex Developer
description:
Our client is a large Government Organisation and they have a project piece of work for x2 Oracle Apex Developers. You will sit in a team of 15 people and will the have the opportunity to be in the office and also work from home.

Being the Oracle Apex Developer, you will work on our clients project as they plan to upgrade their Apex platform. Before this can occur, the existing APEX applications need to be upgraded to the Oracle Apex Universal Theme.

There are 28 applications that will not migrate over in their current form, so they will need upgrading. So in this role you will be following a universal theme template across applications and upgrading the applications so they can be uplifted and moved to a later version.

The work is low level in terms of coding and will suit a person whom is looking for a short contract, as it is an ASAP start and goes for 2 ½ months.

Key skills needed:

  • Has oracle APEX knowledge and/or experience
  • Can work quickly and efficiently
  • Proactive
  • Excellent communications skills

Your Laptop/Desktop will be provided. So if you have Oracle Apex experience give us a call today!

Robert Walters endeavours to review all applications in a maximum of five working days. If you have not received correspondence within this timeframe please do not hesitate to contact Ange Chapman on 04 471 9707.


Our client is a large Government Organisation and they have a project piece of work for x2 Oracle Apex Developers. You will sit in a team of 15 people and will the have the opportunity to be in the office and also work from home.

name: Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack Developer
description:
iQualify is seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack Developer who wants to be part of a successful and fast growing ed tech product. This role can be based in Lower Hutt or remotely.

We're discovering how to make the world's most engaging vocational learning experience every day for hundreds of New Zealand businesses and hundreds of thousands of learners. Join the team that builds iQualify, New Zealand's fastest growing social learning platform.

Backed by 70 years of distance learning experience by The Open Polytechnic, New Zealand's specialist provider of open and distance learning, from certificate to diploma and degree level, and is internationally recognised in its field.

What's the role?

We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), to join a broad product team with roles ranging from UX, visual design, learning design, customer experience and software developers.

What you'll need:

  • Extensive experience as a Full Stack Developer
  • Experience in production monitoring and service improvement
  • Experience in developing and delivering automation systems
  • Extensive programming experience in web application development technologies including Angular, Node JS, Javascript, CSS, HTML(5)
  • Experience with database application design and development in NoSQL and document data stores
  • Experience working within a team in applications development
  • Experience with effective use of development platforms and tools
  • Good experience with cloud platforms
  • Experience with lean, agile and XP development practices

We are looking for someone who:

  • Is right at home troubleshooting and diagnosing potential issues. Diving into the technical detail is your thing
  • Has experience working with software platforms and tools to make people's lives easier
  • Has well-developed problem solving skills - you'll need these every day
  • Is able to think proactively, anticipate problems and work with team members to implement innovative solutions
  • Has plenty of opinions about how to make things better
  • Is a results-orientated approach to initiative
  • Has great relationship building skills
  • Loves working with users to analyse, define and document requirements and specifications
  • Has excellent verbal and written communication skills that you'll demonstrate by writing an outstanding cover letter showing us why you're the person we're looking for. Wow us with your style.

What's in it for you?

  • We provide a supportive and creative place to work developing learning solutions that help learners and our partners succeed.
  • We're equipped with coffee and frequent pet visitors.
  • We're located out in the Hutt Valley if that's a bonus for you, or you can work from anywhere within NZ
  • You'll be challenged and supported and be an integral part of a team developing the world's most engaging social learning platform.

Still interested? We're keen for you to interview us. Hit the apply button.

Applications close midday Wednesday 7 October 2020. Please note only online applications will be accepted.

name: Senior Web Developer
description:
• JavaScript (Es5+) CSS3, HTML5 & React & Redux
  • AWS Infrastructure (Lambda, Microservices, API Gateway)
  • Essential services leading business, fantastic benefits + package

With an influx of new opportunities and a passion to keep ahead of the game, this industry knows no boundaries! The company is a household name and a market leader in their industry. Regardless of COVID, the organization is full steam ahead with major modernization programs, requiring a Senior Front End Developer professional to help them lead this transformation.

As a large organization, they are a highly desirable place to work because of their in-demand technologies, training opportunities, career development, salary package, and job security!

The role:
As an experienced Software Developer, you'll be responsible for working in conjunction with the other Developers and Solution Architects to help support and develop applications and frameworks.

You will play a key part in writing technical documentation to support projects as well as providing support to systems specialists and work across enhancements and Maintainance.

Key Skills and Experience Required:

  • At least four years (commercial experience) working as a Software Developer mostly in a scrum/agile environment
  • Ability to gather software and business requirements
  • The expertise to understand and relay technical concepts
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • The passion for knowledge sharing and collaboration
  • Forward-thinking and the willingness to keep learning

What the squad currently works with:

  • JavaScript(ES6), HTML5, CSS3
  • JavaScript libraries - React & TypeScript
  • NodeJS!
  • AWS Infrastructure Principles (Lambda, Microservices, API Gateway)
  • Their running on multi platforms (Mac, Linux & Windows)
  • Git Version Controls (GIT, Github, Bitbucket)
  • An understanding of Java is desirable

This is the perfect time for an individual to make a career move. Our well-respected client is at the forefront of technology and offers an environment that is progressive and challenging.

Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Please apply using an MS WORD version of your CV, as if we proceed with your application this is the format we’ll require to submit to clients.

TJ1013887


Job Ref TJ1013887
Location Auckland CBD
Category IT & Digital
Type Permanent - Full Time
Teresa Jordan Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist 021 772 103
teresa@haloconsulting.co.nz

name: Senior Business Analyst
description:
You'll be working as a senior member of the team that delivers TVNZ OnDemand and OneNews, playing a pivotal role in delivering news and entertainment to all New Zealanders.

In this role you will work on initiatives and see them through to a successful implementation, while ensuring that existing systems continue to meet the high expectations of our customers.

Our team uses a collaborative and agile approach, working closely with product managers, developers, testers and business experts.

About you:

Ideally you will have significant business analysis experience using Agile delivery to continuously improve digital products. We're looking for someone who likes to jump into the detail, but can also step back to provide a viewer/client/business perspective.

You will be someone who enjoys working with people to build strong teams to drive delivery. Other experience and strengths you'll bring to the table:

  • Background in Media or Digital products.
  • Familiar with Jira, Slack, Confluence, Trello and Teams.
  • Passion for improving viewer experience by defining user epics and stories.
  • Great communicator.
  • A motivated self-starter.
  • Inquisitive problem solver.


About the team:

The digital team is a passionate group of cross-functional people covering engineering, test, product management, business analysis and user experience/design. We imagine, prioritise, build, release and support every aspect of our digital offerings.

We have various options available to provide flexibility around hours and place of work, although we do value regular time in the office together. There are just some things that work better in person! This means we can work together around things like school drop offs and/or other responsibilities you may have.

We're a diverse bunch and we place a high value on teamwork & joint ownership.

We bring our whole selves to work and we'd love it if you did too!


About TVNZ:

TVNZ is one of New Zealand's best known and most well loved businesses. Every day we join over 2 million kiwis in their lunchrooms, lounge rooms, bedrooms and on whatever gadget they carry around. Whether we're breaking news, following adventures, sharing stories, or simply putting smiles on faces, we're all about doing it better, smarter and on more screens than anyone else.

name: iOS App Developer
description:
This employer requires a student iOS developer with experience submitting an iOS app to the App Store.

We are a small start up in the health & fitness sector looking to assist with the development of an existing iOS application for our service.

You will take the existing basic application and assess the functionality and security of its code. You will then finish the application to a high standard of functionality and aesthetic appeal.

You will provided with guidance from our team throughout the process, but will need to know what you are doing and be able to work alone as well.

The successful applicant will possess the following skills:
  • Fluent in Swift coding language and experience capably navigating Xcode for Macintosh.
  • Experience submitting a fully functional application to the iOS App Store .
  • Experience programming a private messaging function , similar to Facebook Messenger - this is critical
  • Programmatic development is required (development using storyboards is not preferred)
All computer equipment is provided.

Working hours will be flexible, usually between 6pm and 10pm. You can expect to work for around 10 hours a week for one to two weeks - however, this will be negotiated with the successful applicant based on your understanding of how much work there is to be done.

The remuneration for this work will be $25.00 an hour.

name: Embedded Developer
description:
• Fun and fast-paced commercial project
  • C/C++, embedded Linux development
  • Contract or permanent opportunities available!
Our client is a market leader in the marine industry and known for making innovative and reliable products. Due to a busy project cycle, they require the help of an experienced Contract Developer to get their new product across the line!

What you will be doing:

Working on a fast-paced, greenfields product you will build reliable and high-quality C and C++ code. The environment you will be dealing with on the daily is embedded Linux operating systems and RTOS'.

What you'll need to be successful:
  • In-depth knowledge of C/C++
  • Embedded Linux development - application, kernel and device drivers
  • Linux system engineering
  • FreeRTOS
  • Experience with digital communication protocols (e.g. I2C, SPI, and DSI)
You must be able to start in 2weeks and hold a valid NZ Work Visa!

Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Please apply using an MS WORD version of your CV, as if we proceed with your application this is the format we’ll require to submit to clients.

Note: We review all CV's manually and you will only be contacted if your skills and experience meet the requirements of any of our clients.

LD_904425

name: Senior PHP Developer
description:
Welcome to Powered by Flossie!

Are you an exceptional backend developer / engineer who has worked on websites operating at a global scale? Do you know how to write queries and migrations for large database clusters without breaking them? Can you do all of the above while preserving and improving API response times and resource consumption?

If so, we are searching for a Senior PHP Engineer to join our Auckland based team in a permanent full-time role.

You will be working within an agile team directly with our CTO and React Developers on a variety of client projects that are challenging and incredibly rewarding.

If you’re a self-starter looking for a rare opportunity to flex your skills within a lean team for a NZ start-up to scale-up working with multinational clients, then please read on.


Who we are and what we do.

Powered by Flossie gives multinational, enterprise hair and beauty product companies the ability to finally market appointments on behalf of their salon partners.

We offer a single, powerful API that connects to all the different booking software, aggregating fragmented salon networks (and data) into a branded streamlined marketing and booking platform. We enable product companies to digitise without disrupting their entire B2B network.

Powered by Flossie is a New Zealand founded and owned business started by serial tech entrepreneurs Jenene Crossan and Steve Torrance.

Our purpose (and why we turn up to work every day), is we believe that services are the last bastion of e-commerce opportunities not yet explored, with enormous scope and scale. By targeting and fixing the very specific and known strategic pain point within large scale global corporate partners, we are bringing this vision to life at a rapid pace.

Learn more about us here: https://poweredbyflossie.com/

NB: maybe you remember the name Flossie.com from our market place? Powered by Flossie is the software behind the consumer proposition and has gone on to be the golden goose of the company.

Requirements

What you’ll be doing.

In this dynamic autonomous role, no week will be the same. You can expect to be:

  • Maintaining and evolving our API architecture to build solid foundations for global scale.
  • Handling complex third-party integrations that don’t offer a glamorous API or even have existing documentation.
  • Collaborating with React Devs to contribute to the overall UX/UI and feature set of the frontend booking platform
  • Helping to automate common tasks and improve our in-house administration tools

The business is scaling into global markets (UK/US/AU/EU), while the code-base has existed for 8-years, we require an exceptional individual to join us to help continue to build upon it - utilising their initiative and solution focussed input.

What you need to bring.

Core tech stack:

  • PHP
  • Aurora DB (MySQL)
  • Solr
  • Nginx
  • Redis
  • Ubuntu

Professional experience:

  • 3+ years commercial experience in managing complex databases, security, product development and usable interfaces.
  • 4+ years in PHP application development. You’ve written not only secure code, but it can easily scale to a large number of users.
  • Significant experience in how to work with clustered database solutions and SQL.
  • Experience working with large amounts of frequently updated data.
  • Experience with AWS. You've built apps that run and scale in AWS.
  • Previous roles within SaaS / enterprise software/technology.
  • Natural leader, collaborator and resourceful.
  • Ability to work independently yet a no-ego, collaborative attitude when working with non-technical team members.

We’re not fussed about your academic history but we do care about your professional experience.

Extra points awarded for those who have international business experience.

We are only able to accept applications from those who are based in Auckland, with the right to work in New Zealand.

Benefits

Why do you want to work at Powered by Flossie.

We’re at an exciting phase in the business; scaling our commercial opportunities globally and investing more into our existing tech stack.

We’re privately backed and supported by seasoned, tech focussed, diverse and commercial investors, advisors and board members, such as Sir Stephen Tindall, Rob Campbell and Adrian Burr.

Founders Jenene Crossan and Steve Torrance have a 20-year business partnership history (having worked extensively across different businesses together). They bring unique styles and years of experience to learn from and work symbiotically well.

Your inquisitive mind and interest to understand the industry our technology serves will be fulfilled in this exciting role.

  • You will be offered a competitive salary.
  • We work within a flexible environment (home, office, it’s up to you!).
  • We trust that you will see tasks through to completion and communicate with your fellow team members when needed or ask for help when needed.
  • We will provide you with opportunities to further develop your career.
  • Incentive / share option packages are available for all team members.
  • You will continue to help scale an amazing piece of software working with some of the biggest product companies in the world, within a lean* family-friendly environment to make an immediate impact
  • We believe in running a scale-up small & perfectly formed, without the vanity metrics around team numbers. Expect to find a balanced team, who believe in getting a good night’s sleep.

What happens next?

We’re a lean team and finding the right fit both culturally and experience is super critical to us.

We want you to be joining us because you can see the impact you can make and are aligned to the purpose and vision for the business. You also want to have a life, go for a surf if you want, and be part of something really exciting.

By joining us we want you to bring your true self to work each day and be proud to be who you are. Our team lives by this - we know better, so we do better.

To apply for this role, simply send us the following to hello@poweredbyflossie.com

  • A quick cover letter to introduce yourself and your experience.
  • Attach your relevant professional experience by way of CV/Resume and a bonus if you have a public github repo ready to show us.

We’ll be in touch whether you're a right fit to continue this conversation.

name: Backend Developer - SQL, EDI, Integration
description:
• Essential service organisation that has been inundated with work
  • South Auckland | 2-3 months contract | Transport industry
  • Variety of work and customer focussed
Due to an ever increasing customer base, a Python / SQL Developer is required for 2-3 months for an immediate start role located near the airport.

You will be part of a small team and will directly report to the Applications Manager. You will be tasked with delivering integration solutions between my clients systems and their customers. Strong development experience needed where you can ensure our client maintains their point of difference.

The Skills:
  • Python or SQL experience and if you have Delphi this gives you an advantage
  • Flow Software integration experience will take you to the forefront but Mulesoft or Biztalk as a minimum
  • EDI and strong integration experience needed
  • Strong back end programming skills and exposure to different environments
  • Able to work independently and with a can-do attitude
  • Effective time management and organistaion skills
If you are interested and immediately available please send your CV to gantuangco@ocg.co.nz. You must have eligibility to work in NZ for you to be considered for this role.

name: Senior Microsoft Full-Stack Developer
description:
About Us

Flintfox is an award-winning provider of expert ERP solutions and services globally. We love developing technology, but it's the impact it has on our customers that really excites us. We provide intelligent solutions which optimise trade revenue, pricing and promotions across a wide range of verticals. Our culture of collaboration and partnership enables us to continue to delight our customers with our software.

Headquartered in Auckland, we have offices across Europe, North America and Latin America and over 100 staff (our Flintfoxers) globally.

We are a strong adopter of Microsoft technologies and a Microsoft Gold Partner being one of only a handful of Global ISVs for Microsoft Dynamics ERP solutions.


To accelerate the development and continued advancement of our exciting platform and product we are seeking a talented full-stack Microsoft web developer. We are looking for someone who has experience and passion for web technologies and delivering beautiful, responsive and interactive solutions. You will be someone who appreciates that design aesthetics and functionality go hand in hand.


You will work collaboratively with the stakeholders, architects, & team members to help design UI, front-end focused features along with server-side development integrating our core processes and workflows. You will need to be a team player who enjoys a role with responsibility and can also work autonomously to deliver results.


Flintfox is a place where you can flex your imagination in designing and developing industry leading features that are reliable and scalable while providing an excellent customer experience, creating something spectacular for our customers.

A Few Essentials for the Role

  • A minimum of 5 years' experience in web development
  • Excellent spoken and written English communication skills
  • Advanced knowledge of .NET Core, C# and ASP.NET MVC
  • Advanced knowledge of HTML5, JQuery / JavaScript / TypeScript
  • Microsoft SQL Server and T-SQL
  • Experience with IoC, preferably Autofac
  • Experience with Kendo UI and Angular/React
  • Knowledge of cross-browser and cross-device development
  • Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for both UI and backend components (full-stack)
  • Experience in optimizing for page performance and responsive web design strategies
  • Willingness to learn new technologies and embrace challenges
  • Experience mentoring peers
  • Working with Agile development practices & Scrum project methodologies.

"Nice to Haves"; but not deal breakers! Have you worked with any of the following?

  • SignalR, Web API and OData
  • Entity Framework (EF) or other ORM
  • Managed Extensibility Framework (MEF)
  • OAuth 2.0.

The Benefits

  • This is an opportunity to work with a group of highly skilled and motivated industry professionals delivering excellence and innovation as part of our Research & Development team. The team is tight, and supportive with no big egos or hard-line management hierarchy
  • New product development, the opportunity to play a key role in the success of our product roadmap with the development of leading edge on premise and SaaS/Cloud based software
  • Career opportunities to grow your role and your skills as our product develops; future plans for the product include Microservices, advanced BI and predictive analytics
  • The latest Microsoft technologies.

The prospects are boundless. At Flintfox you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really value and love. Come and join us on the journey.


To apply submit your CV, cover letter and examples of previous web design you have played a key role in producing.


For more information about what it's like to work at Flintfox check out our website www.flintfox.com/careers and our Instagram account: @flintfox.staff


Flintfox is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Offers may be subject to satisfactory security clearance. All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand.


**Recruitment Agencies - thank you for thinking of us; however, we do endeavour to fill our opportunities through direct channels wherever possible**

name: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer  upto $135hr + GST
description:
Multiple contract opportunities which can be carried out from your own home (in NZ). These roles are part of a very large project. The first phase is budgeted until the end of June 2021.

Are you either a Ruby Developer with extensive Ruby on Rails (RoR) or a Ruby on Rails expert (with other Programming languages)? Have you built highly scalable applications?

If so, we strongly recommend that you read on!

This is a large SaaS Organisation with massive ongoing growth due to a very large and positive business transformation.

The company is based in Central Auckland however, Remote Work permitted (within NZ only).The organisation are already a highly secure entity with a large development team throughout the country. Their vision now is to further add substantial growth to the Auckland division.

Within these roles you will use your in depth and senior expertise on developing a number of structures for Web Services, Web Pages and Databases alike through your expertise in either Ruby, Java or other based development while having the existing capability to add a Full Stack ‘flair’ using multiple Frameworks and Front End capability.

The skills that will encourage success in your application are:

  • Ruby Development – at least 3yrs recent experience as part of a Full Stack Development career which should be of at least 5yrs.
  • Environment – This should include working within a SaaS type environment. We require applicants to have expertise in CI / CD, Automation and Source Controls.
  • Front End – extensive expertise in JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
  • Frameworks – Ruby on Rails (preferred) it is also beneficial to have experience on other Frameworks
  • Other – UI programming, AWS, Agile, Jira.
  • Visa Status – we are currently prioritising applications from individuals who already hold a valid Work Visa for New Zealand at the time of application.

    Please submit your CV via this jobsite to Carl Robinson (09 302 7024)

name: Intermediate Front-End Developer
description:
We are looking for a talented and passionate frontend developer to help our front-end efforts. This would be an individual contributor role.

**What you will be responsible for:**

  • Implementing and maintaining Thematic's product
  • Automated testing and quality of front-end web application
  • Validation and iteration while implementing UX designs


Requirements

**What you will bring to the table:**

  • 2 or more years of experience in web technologies such as Vue, React, Webpack, SCSS; and curiosity to learn more.
  • Experience consuming API's
  • Familiar with test automation
  • Experience using Git
  • Worked on single page apps
  • Strive to do work you're proud of, both technically and in your team interactions; behave like an owner
  • Experience working in a remote environment


**What you might have, although it's not required:**

  • Experience building Enterprise level SaaS applications
  • Worked in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Worked in a distributed team
  • Contributed to open-source projects
  • Appreciation for visual design

** Where will you work :**

  • We are a remote company. Our team is split between US and NZ.
  • Ideally, you should be based in New Zealand, but we would accept candidates who are within 3h of NZT, e.g. PST.

Benefits

**Salary range:**

- $70K - $100K NZD, equivalent to $45K - $65K USD

  • ESOP
  • Home Office allowance $400/mo

name: Senior Developer
description:
As a result of steady growth within their niche customer base, our client, Costing and Business Solutions (CBS) requires a Senior Developer to join their team. They offer a supportive team environment where you will have the chance to broaden your skills as you are involved in all aspects of the development process.

CBS is a progressive IT business based in Hamilton that is making a significant impact in the Health Sectors of Australasia and further afield. Health Boards have been able to better direct finances to the most needed areas as a result the systems CBS has designed and implemented. CBS specialises in providing Activity Based Costing, Patient Billing, Data Warehousing, KPI Dashboards and advanced Business Intelligence using the Microsoft Stack.

We are looking for someone to join our team who is committed to delivering outstanding technology-based solutions to client problems using best practices and defined processes; where solving problems, meeting client expectations and mentoring other Developers are top priorities. We are looking for a person with:

  • The ability to work effectively both individually and as part of a team; accepting personal accountability and displaying a commitment to collaborate
  • The ability to mentor and get the best out of other Developers
  • Strong written and oral communication skills with an emphasis on communicating well with clients (both external and internal)
  • 5 years relevant commercial experience (minimum)

  • Experience with a range of technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server, Angular, ASP.net
  • Experience in AGILE development methodologies

If you are looking to advance your career, lead Developer teams and face new challenges, apply today.

Please note you must be living in New Zealand and have the right to work here to be considered for this role.

name: Product Owner - Bank Reconciliation (work on the Xero Produc...
description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

About the role

This opportunity is ideal for someone with some Product Owner experience but still lots of room to grow. You'll be joining a mature team of 7 Xeros (Devs, Team Lead and a grad developer), who have well established practices.

This Product Owner role sits within our Payments, Billing and Automation products group. These products are consumed by our customers everyday!
Cashflow is the life blood of small business, and in this role you'll be directly helping our customers reconcile their cashflow. You'll be able to see the long term wins from building beautiful technology, and know how to prioritise courageously. To solve customer problems, you'll take a measure and adjust approach, and you'll coach your delivery pod in these skills, to value outcomes over outputs.

As a Product Owner, you will work with a delivery team who will look to you for guidance and support every day to build the best experiences for our customers (current and prospective). As a passionate and skilled product person, you'll enjoy working with other product people, including product managers, product owners, designers, researchers, analysts and delivery teams including team facilitators, developers and QAs. This role will benefit from enough technical knowledge to have empathy for your engineer teammates, but you don't need to be able to write code yourself. You'll work closely with other teams from the wider business, such as support, product, training and sales, who help bring your solutions to market - and be used by millions of people every day.

We are looking for someone with:

  • Some experience as a product Owner (Ideally delivering software products)
  • Hands-on experience with Agile processes and facilitation
  • An open and effective communication style and the ability to build relationships at all levels
  • A focus on impact and putting the customer first
But why work at Xero?

At Xero, we are rewiring the small business economy and want millions of small businesses to thrive through beautiful software, advice, and connections.

We see the value in work-life balance, many of us take full advantage of our flexible working arrangements, so whether you like to get a surf in before work, like to head home in time to pick up the kids or you just like working from the comfort of your own home now and then, we want to support you.

We trust you to build your career to the best of your ability and we will support your hunger to learn with training and career mentorship, to help you flourish.

Our facilities and PX teams work hard to give us great workspaces with all the tech company perks like a great social club and sports teams you can join, free fruit, soft drinks and espresso coffee, as well as video games, pool and ping pong tables.

If this sound like you then apply now!

Xero is an NZ Immigration Accredited Employer and Rainbow Tick certified too.

Please include a cover letter in your application, telling us why you’re a great fit for this position.

name: Senior Geospatial Analyst/Developer
description:
Senior Geospatial Analyst/Developer, National Operations

The National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) provides national leadership to New Zealand’s distributed emergency management system. NEMA’s primary focus is on the performance and capability of the emergency management system as a whole, across all hazards and all risks and the 4 Rs of risk reduction, readiness, response and recovery. We are going through an exciting phase of growth and there will be more opportunities with NEMA over the coming months.

NEMA values diversity and inclusion. We want our workforce to reflect the diversity of our communities. We value and respect the contributions of our people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. We support flexible ways of working that bring out the best in you.

NEMA recognises the continuing partnership Te Tiriti o Waitangi between Māori and the Crown. We are committed to doing our part to deliver on the Crown’s commitments to Māori under Te Tiriti. We strive to actively build te Ao Māori perspectives and capability into our day to day work, values and practices.

The Senior Geospatial Analyst/Developer vacancy is within the National Operations business unit. The NEMA National Operations team leads the operational systems, facilities, infrastructure and processes required to respond effectively to emergencies within New Zealand. This role is based in Wellington.

The Senior Geospatial Analyst/Developer will work with ESRI ArcGIS Enterprise and provide data management, analytics and web mapping to help NEMA utilise the platform to its fullest potential. They will manage geospatial web services to make data available to NEMA, CDEM Groups and other agencies. The Senior Geospatial Analyst/Developer will improve our strategic use of geospatial information in emergency management.

As a Senior Advisor / Geospatial Analyst, you will:
  • Configure and customise the geospatial platform (ESRI ArcGIS Enterprise in Microsoft Azure)
  • Provide ArcGIS Enterprise administration
  • Manage data and services e.g. baseline and operational data including surveys or damage assessments
  • Script and automate workflows
  • Rapidly design and deliver bespoke analytics and geospatial web applications
  • Embed the geospatial analytical capability into our everyday operations
  • Build and maintain effective relationships with our CDEM stakeholders and central government agencies at both senior and operational levels.
As the Senior Geospatial Analyst/Developer you will bring the following experience and attributes:

  • A relevant tertiary qualification in Geographic Information Systems, Geography, Spatial Science, IT or equivalent
  • Proven experience (minimum three years) with ESRI ArcGIS Enterprise and SAFE FME
  • Advanced analytics and data management skills
  • Experience with databases and programming e.g. Python, Javascript, SQL Server and HTML
  • Knowledge of data protection and data governance
  • Experience in maintaining metadata and writing technical documentation
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, which enable you to seek out opportunities for spatial thinking across the wider emergency management sector and maintain effective internal and external agency relationships
  • Experience working in a high pressure strategic or operational environment.
Due to the security requirements of this role, applicants must be a New Zealand citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident.

To download a position description or submit an application please visit www.h2r.co.nz/nema. If you have any questions, contact Paul Hodder on 04 4999471 or email paul.hodder@h2r.co.nz referring to vacancy number 26381.

Applications close 11.59 pm 14 October 2020.

name: Mobile Software Engineer (iOS & Android)
description:
ClearPoint
ClearPoint is a digital design and engineering company. name: Solutions Architect
description:
Do you want to do something world leading and life changing?

With global populations growing and healthcare costs climbing there is huge opportunity for technology to revolutionize and disrupt healthcare delivery. Fisher and Paykel Healthcare is a world leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of medical devices and export to over 120 countries globally. We develop products that help people, and we are proud of it.

About the role:

You will be at the forefront of IoT and cloud service development, joining our Informatics group to build world-class connected medical device systems. In this role you will lead the architecture of our cloud platform, used by patients and healthcare providers all over the world, to monitor, understand, and optimize patient therapy. You'll be responsible for creating a technology platform that is secure, scalable, performant, and usable by developers of all levels.

About You:

  • Deep understanding of scalable cloud service architectures
  • An experienced coder with a passion for hands on development
  • Strong communication skills, and the ability to share your knowledge effectively with others
  • Critical thinker and pragmatic programmer.
  • Eye for detail and a passion for getting things done.

You are an accomplished Software Architect with a track record of delivering successful commercial software. You deeply understand the technology you work with and are able to think creatively to solve complex problems in simple and elegant ways. You enjoy working in team environments and understand the importance of sharing your knowledge with others, and learning from those around you. You have experience developing others and get satisfaction from enabling them to do their best work. You understand the value of good software design and can lead by example. You are comfortable with giving and receiving feedback.

Skills and Experience:

  • 10+ years developing commercial software, a good deal of that in cloud services.
  • Deep understanding of commercial cloud platforms, and best practices for distributed cloud systems.
  • Competent in the following languages: C#, JavaScript & SQL, HTML & CSS (or SASS/LESS)
  • Experience with the following frameworks: ASP .NET MVC, ASP .NET Web API, Single page application frameworks, eg React, Vue, Kendo UI, Service bus's, eg, Rabbit MQ
  • Experience in Microsoft Azure

About Us:

We have a culture that is open to new and diverse ideas. We are always looking to work with the right frameworks, technology and techniques to make our products just that little bit better. We value taking the time to do things right and we care deeply about quality in the work that we do. We promote ownership and self-leadership in our people. We encourage continuous learning.

Be part of one of NZ's fastest growing and most successful organizations. Put your skills into meaningful work, creating products that are transforming healthcare and creating positive, lasting change to the lives of hundreds of thousands of people world-wide.

If this sounds like you, please apply today.

Applications close 13 October 2020.

name: Intermediate Front End Developer
description:
We develop and distribute disruptive technology that innovates, automates, and changes the Veterinary market globally. Auckland HQ is where the bulk of the engineering horsepower is based with a turbo charged London operation that continues to grow. We run a pod structure (currently 7), follow agile methodology, write elegant code to the tune of Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 on black widow mechanical keyboards…well not really but it sounds provocative.

We are in the process of releasing a re-architected application with completely separated Front End & Back End. The Front End is being rebuilt in ReactJS/Redux and the Back End is being rebuilt in Laravel, all with best practice principles front and center. Think the stability of a established application with the code standards of a start-up code base.

We are on a quest for an Intermediate Front End Developer. You will be part of our small Front End team who is taking charge of upgrading our legacy application into a new, revamped ReactJS App. As a Front End Developer, you'll be 100% dedicated to the new tools

What your day may look like:

  • The design and build of front end framework to achieve a completely separated back and front end of ezyVet.
  • Taking an active role in project planning discussions, collaborating with project engineers and key stakeholders, and leading on front end development considerations.
  • Auditing and evaluating front-end code structure resulting in a consistent, clean, scalable and robust front end.
  • Documenting processes and policies to be utilized by the wider development team.
  • Training and mentoring developers.

What you'll bring

  • 2+ years of commercial front-end web development experience.
  • Proven success with React.
  • A keen interest in the look, feel and experience for cloud applications
  • A great attitude - our team is filled with a bunch of inspirational, driven individuals that have a great attitude towards development
  • Experience developing and/or consuming API's

We're looking for someone passionate, curious and collaborative to fill this role. If you're hungry to learn, keen to grow and excited by our journey, then we'd love to hear from you!

About ezyVet

With a little kiwi ingenuity and a lot of passion, ezyVet came into existence. A cloud-based, feature rich software solution for Veterinary Practices all around the world. ezyVet is quietly disrupting the global veterinary industry. With customers in over 20 countries, 120+ staff across offices in London, Dallas and Auckland, there's no better time than now to join the ezyVet journey.

name: Trading Systems Data Engineer
description:
Company Profile:

Kenetic Trading is a proprietary trading firm that deploys medium and high frequency trading strategies in the global cryptocurrency markets. Based in Hong Kong, we are a 24/7 business, trading digital assets in 10+ locations around the globe, with a team of world-class talent spanning 5 countries.

We are one of the fastest growing market makers in the entire industry. Our arbitrage engines generate tens of millions of orders per day, and our trading team combines a systematic approach with sophisticated pricing models, iterating regularly to ensure robust trading performance.

More information can be found on our company website: http://www.kenetic.capital

Summary of Position:

This is an opportunity to become both steward and champion for the firm's market and trading data archives and the systems which capture, transform and load trading data to and from those archives.

You’ll learn from our experienced trading team and help develop and support systems that execute millions of trades on ‘crypto’ exchanges across the globe.

Reporting to: Chief Technology Officer

Job responsibilities include:

  • Assume end to end accountability for the warehoused data, helping modify trading systems to add telemetry as well as conducting the design and deployment of the data pipeline infrastructure
  • Create tools to automate the configuration, deployment and troubleshooting of the data pipeline
  • Develop strategies to make our data pipeline efficient, timely and robust in a 24/7 trading environment
  • Implement monitoring that measures the completeness and accuracy of captured data
  • Manage the impact that changes to trading systems and upstream protocols have on the data pipeline
  • Back populate and clean historical datasets
  • Collaborate with traders and trading system developers to understand our data analysis requirements, and to continue to improve the quality of our stored data
  • Develop tools, APIs and screens to provide easy access to the archived data

Position Requirements:

  • A Python programmer, experienced using asyncio
  • 3+ years experience developing in C++, on linux
  • Experience with developing real time large scale data pipelines, with petabytes of data
  • Experience with distributed, high performance SQL and NoSQL database systems
  • You have excellent written and verbal English
  • You are reliable, take pride in delivering robust software and are willing to be on call to support the systems you develop.
  • A bachelor's degree (or above) in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar, with excellent results.
  • Experience with AWS or other cloud computing infrastructure

Highly Desirable:

o Linux system administration skills

o Protocol level network analysis experience

o Experience with terraform

o Experience with Hive and Hadoop

o Experience with cryptocurrency exchanges, and cryptocurrency trading

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

  • developing in C++ on linux: 3 years (Required)

Education:

  • Secondary School (Preferred)

name: Product Manager - SaaS
description:
The Company

Having been operating in ANZ and Europe for the last ~10 years, this NZ owned business will shortly expanding into new markets. They operate out of brand new offices in the City Fringe, have a high performing yet laid-back culture and offer flexible working hours.

The Role
As a Product Manager, you will be reporting to the Head of Product as part of a wider team of ~30 in the office. The role is a newly created position due to expansion and you will be researching, validating and driving new ideas to a high quality end product.

The company has 4 squads with each squad comprised of 4-5 developers, 1 X Designer and 1 X Product Manager - This role sits within the squad that is responsible for new feature development and enhancements to the core product, so you will really be able to make your mark on the future direction of the product. name: Senior Management Consultant - Major Projects Advisory
description:
KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG’s Global Infrastructure business is one of the world's leading advisors to the infrastructure sector (www.kpmg.com/infrastructure). Our team in New Zealand advises public and private sector clients on all aspects of the financing, structuring, procurement, delivery and operations of infrastructure. Our advice is independent and draws on deep sector experience within our local regional and global teams.

The role:

  • KPMG’s New Zealand Infrastructure Advisory team is experiencing rapid growth and is seeking to hire a highly skilled professional with deep experience advising on and managing the establishment and delivery of major projects.
  • We are seeking a senior leader at Senior Manager to Director level. This is a strategic role with leadership responsibility and will report directly to the lead Partner of Major Project Advisory.

Day to Day you will:

  • Manage and lead complex client engagements and projects and act as the key client interface
  • Develop effective client and stakeholder relationships with Government, Developers, Construction Groups, Design Consultants, Technology Providers, Investors, Industry Associations and other stakeholders in the industry
  • Lead a wide range of complex assignments across diverse subject matter areas including public policy advisory, project management, project controls advisory, asset management advisory, project risk management, project procurement and contract development and other strategic advisory support with respect to the planning and delivery of major projects
  • Lead and coordinate team members in delivering client research, benchmarking, analysis, high quality client reports and presentations, client proposals, thought leadership publications, internal reports and other materials as required in the course of business
  • Proactively support implementing the team’s growth strategy
  • Lead marketing and communication activities related to infrastructure
  • Proactive engagement with KPMG’s global and regional Major Projects Advisory and Infrastructure networks

What you'll bring to our team:

  • 12+ years professional experience across design, consulting, project management, engineering or related activities
  • Consulting experience as well as construction project delivery experience;
  • A degree and professional qualification in project management, engineering, architecture, planning or accounting
  • Strong interest and passion for complex projects; infrastructure, government, project management, construction and engineering
  • Deep experience in developing and delivering project controls services, commercial and contract advice, project reviews and risk management services to infrastructure and real estate projects in an advisory/consulting environment.
  • Strong analytical, financial, contractual and commercial skills
  • A positive and flexible attitude and an enthusiasm to embrace new challenges and growth opportunities to gain experience
  • A demonstrable track record of building lasting client relationships, winning new business and developing existing business
  • Strong interpersonal skills will enable you to successfully engage with a variety of internal and external stakeholders and an ability to bring people together, develop meaningful relationships, integrate services and work collaboratively with a team of experts across the wider consulting teams

  • With current border and quarantine restrictions in place, KPMG New Zealand are unable to consider applications from candidates that do not currently have the right to live and work in New Zealand. To be legally entitled to work in New Zealand, you should be a New Zealand citizen or permanent resident, or hold a valid work visa. Please check the New Zealand Immigration website for the most up to date information.
We are a 2020 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

name: Road Corridor Manager
description:
Tauranga is New Zealand's fastest growing and fifth largest city. Managing this growth makes for a challenging and dynamic work environment. Tauranga City Council is focused on the City's future and responding to the changing needs of the community. We want to work with our community to successfully plan for and understand their needs and expectations.

At Tauranga City Council we are responsible for managing activities on the roading network to ensure safe, efficient and reliable journeys to customers across the Bay of Plenty region. The Road Corridor Manager plays a crucial role by reviewing and approving corridor access requests which means dealing with developers, contractors, consultants, utility operators, event organisers and the general public on a daily basis. The Road Corridor Manager has a finger on the pulse of everything that's going on in Tauranga and no two days are the same.

We are looking for an exceptional Road Corridor Manager to join our team, reporting to the Team Leader: Corridor Access & Temporary Traffic Management. Ensuring worker and public safety, managing the impact to all modes of transport and providing a top level of customer service whilst maintaining a professional attitude at all times. This is an exciting opportunity for an organised, self-motivated individual to make a positive impact on the community. The successful applicant will be confident working in a high performing team building relationships both internally and externally while being a subject matter expert in traffic management and activities in the road reserve.

For this role, you will ideally have;

  • A Temporary Traffic Management qualification STMS Level 2/3 (NP)
  • Minimum of three years' experience in a traffic management, roading, utilities or similar role, preferably working with or alongside Local Government or NZTA.
  • Exposure to relevant legislations and regulations such as Health & Safety at Work Act 2015, Utilities Act 2010 and the Code of Practice for Temporary Traffic Management (CoPTTM).
  • Well-developed problem solving skills and a commitment to continuous improvement
  • Sound organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritise tasks
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Digitally savvy, particularly in the Microsoft Office suite.

At Tauranga City Council, we believe in supporting our talent and we offer a range of learning and development opportunities and flexible working conditions to help you achieve the most from your career.

If you're looking for a career where you can make a real difference, then we would love to hear from you and have you join our team!

Applications close Friday 23 October 2020.

description:
Our client is a large Government Organisation and they have a project piece of work for x2 Oracle Apex Developers. You will sit in a team of 15 people and will the have the opportunity to be in the office and also work from home.

Being the Oracle Apex Developer, you will work on our clients project as they plan to upgrade their Apex platform. Before this can occur, the existing APEX applications need to be upgraded to the Oracle Apex Universal Theme.

There are 28 applications that will not migrate over in their current form, so they will need upgrading. So in this role you will be following a universal theme template across applications and upgrading the applications so they can be uplifted and moved to a later version.

name: Senior Business Analyst
description:
You'll be working as a senior member of the team that delivers TVNZ OnDemand and OneNews, playing a pivotal role in delivering news and entertainment to all New Zealanders.

In this role you will work on initiatives and see them through to a successful implementation, while ensuring that existing systems continue to meet the high expectations of our customers.

Our team uses a collaborative and agile approach, working closely with product managers, developers, testers and business experts.

About you:

Ideally you will have significant business analysis experience using Agile delivery to continuously improve digital products. We're looking for someone who likes to jump into the detail, but can also step back to provide a viewer/client/business perspective.

You will be someone who enjoys working with people to build strong teams to drive delivery. Other experience and strengths you'll bring to the table:

  • Background in Media or Digital products.
  • Familiar with Jira, Slack, Confluence, Trello and Teams.
  • Passion for improving viewer experience by defining user epics and stories.
  • Great communicator.
  • A motivated self-starter.

About the team:

The digital team is a passionate group of cross-functional people covering engineering, test, product management, business analysis and user experience/design. We imagine, prioritise, build, release and support every aspect of our digital offerings.

We have various options available to provide flexibility around hours and place of work, although we do value regular time in the office together. There are just some things that work better in person! This means we can work together around things like school drop offs and/or other responsibilities you may have.

We're a diverse bunch and we place a high value on teamwork & joint ownership.

We bring our whole selves to work and we'd love it if you did too!


About TVNZ:

TVNZ is one of New Zealand's best known and most well loved businesses. Every day we join over 2 million kiwis in their lunchrooms, lounge rooms, bedrooms and on whatever gadget they carry around. Whether we're breaking news, following adventures, sharing stories, or simply putting smiles on faces, we're all about doing it better, smarter and on more screens than anyone else.

name: Major Developments Lead - Infrastructure
description:
Permanent position working 40 hours per week.

Napier is a lively and vibrant city, offering an exceptional climate as well as plentiful opportunities for family, recreation and relaxation. Improved road and air links are helping to make Napier one of New Zealand's most popular, liveable and easily accessible cities.

Napier City Council is one of Napier's biggest and most desirable employers - we value excellence, integrity, sustainability and outstanding customer and community service.

The purpose of this newly created role is to deliver Council's internal residential subdivision, Parklands, and to lead the delivery of Council infrastructure for key major greenfield developments across the city. We are looking for someone who understands the development industry and is able to develop collaborative relationships with developers, their agents and key internal people. You need to be customer-focused and enjoy resolving issues.

In addition to the management, timely development and forward planning of the Parklands subdivision, you will have a clear oversight of all major non-council developments to ensure they are enabled and adhere to the Council's code of practice and the District Plan.

You will bring your previous experience in project management involving civil infrastructure, and your knowledge of RMA subdivision and survey processes as well as a working of legislation, regulations and policies at a national, regional and local level. Experience in preparing reports to a professional standard is required.

Other requirements:

  • A tertiary qualification in planning or engineering or equivalent level of knowledge (e.g. 10+ years in a development or project management role involving civil infrastructure)
  • Proven successful project management - on time and on budget
  • Broad knowledge and practical application of engineering, environmental and planning principles
  • Excellent communication and organisational skills with proven ability to meet deadlines and manage stress

If you meet the requirements above and you're looking for a role where you can facilitate change and directly influence the subdivisions around Napier City, look no further - apply now!

You can download the full job description from the careers page on the Napier City Council website.

We will be interviewing suitable candidates as applications are received and may close this advertisement when we have found the right person.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Our preferred candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment screening which includes drug testing and, for some roles, health screening.

To apply for this job go to: http://careers.napier.govt.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5221946.

name: Developer Lead - Portainer.io
description:
Portainer.io: Developer Lead: Who, What, Why & Where

Portainer is on a mission to make container management simple, quick and easy. Whether it's Kubernetes, Swarm, Docker, or Edge compute, the drive to create expert, elegant, simple, yet powerful tools that make the complex simple is what makes us tick.

In its first three years, Portainer has experienced staggering global uptake of its Open Source product, with hundreds of thousands of active users and many hundreds of millions of downloads. Now we're making the transition to our first commercial product, backed by an awesome group of global investors.

To help us bring our vision for Portainer to life, we're searching for a second Developer Lead to manage a small team of developers.

Who?

We're looking for a person, perhaps a first-time leader, with the skills and passion to:

  • Define and implement modern software architectural principles that will underpin the scalability, security, and reliability of the Portainer code who can work across the wider developer community
  • Work cross-functionally inside Portainer and have the ability to influence decision making inside and outside the company
  • Help build and recruit and then lead a world-class, smart and talented development team; through active team leadership, mentoring and coaching
  • Ensure that product release timelines are met and that only quality and secure code is released into the public domain in an agile way.


What?

As the Developer Lead, you will be responsible for:

  • Managing your team of developers to create quality features
  • Managing the day to day developer backlog of your team, and cross-team where appropriate
  • Playing an active role in developing new features for Portainer.io


For this to be the right job for you, you'll need to have demonstrable experience:

  • Developing in AngularJS 1.8 and GoLang. (This is a must-have. Please do not apply if you haven't got these 'must haves' nailed).
  • Building and using Docker and Kubernetes platforms and APIs (almost as critical).
  • Working with cloud provider managed Kubernetes offerings (AKS, EKS, GKE).
  • Using container registry solutions (Docker Registry, Gitlab Registry, Quay.io Registry).
  • Authentication Providers; LDAP (MS AD and OpenLDAP), oAuth (Azure AD, Google Auth, Auth0, OKTA).
  • Monitoring Tools (Prometheus and Graphana).
  • Reverse Proxies (Traefik and Nginx, with and without TLS).
  • Linux and Windows Operating Systems running the Docker engine.
  • Logging tools (ELK stack or GreyLog)

Where?

Portainer is a global company with employees spread across the world. We've invested heavily to ensure that geography doesn't get in our way, and we plan to expand our global footprint rapidly over the coming months.

The right candidate can work in any country they choose, however, our preference is for the person to be in a time zone that allows regular day time interactions with developers in Europe, New Zealand, and the Middle East.

For the right candidate, Portainer.io will offer a sponsored work visa, allowing you to live and work in New Zealand. Consider it a perk of the job!


Why?

Portainer is already exploding; however, we're still very much in our infancy. We are hugely excited about our launch into the commercial world, and we believe we're at the start of a wild ride. Joining Portainer as our Developer Lead will give you:

  • The opportunity to play an instrumental role in shaping a truly disruptive company at the beginning of it's journey.
  • A great remuneration package
  • The flexibility to work remotely as part of a world-class team working on great tech
  • The opportunity to spend time or live in New Zealand, if not the best country in the world, then the best country for the world.

About us:

Hundreds of thousands of organisations around the world have turned to Portainer to help them manage their container platforms. With deployments in almost every country of the world, and at a scale from very small to impressively large, Portainer has become synonymous with our catchphrase of "expert simplicity". Our goal is to provide the most user-friendly means to manage your micro-service platform, regardless of orchestrator, cloud provider, or underlying technology.

name: Senior Java Developer
description:
Halo Consulting is partnering with Chelmer, a leading Wealth Management business to hire Java Developers as their business continue to flourish. Chelmer is a New Zealand-founded financial software company, on a mission to make investing and wealth creation simple, intuitive, and accessible for all. They invest in technology and people and are now seeking to hire multiple Java Developers to join a high-performing team based here in Auckland.

Established in 1988, they have been pioneering broking-, trading- and wealth management technology for over 30 years. Their platforms are trusted by leading financial institutions across Asia Pacific and manage billions of dollars of investor assets.

Chelmer are expanding and we are now looking for Senior Java Developer to join their team. You will collaborate with a team of highly experienced engineers who are developing complex trading systems used within the New Zealand banking and financial market industry.

You will be an accomplished Senior Java Developer with a strong background in system integration. You will be a strong communicator who can meet deadlines and get up to speed with growing trends. Your background will show a thorough history in Java development, working as a senior and full-stack engineer.

What you will be doing:
  • Creating software architecture by designing and developing a reusable software component
  • Defining and promoting the use of well-defined and established software design patterns
  • Designing high performing and scalable software solutions
  • Ensuring code follows standard and is documented
  • Ensuring software architecture integrates with legacy, external and future systems
  • Creating unit tests, regression tests and integration tests
  • Replicating, understanding and fixing issues as quickly as possible

Key Skills and Experience:
  • Java development experience at a senior level – enterprise experience
  • Several years of experience working with Java and Java-related technologies.
  • Experience developing solutions using ElasticSearch
  • Experience developing solutions with REST-based WebServices
  • Commercial experience or the desire to learn to develop solutions with RedHat jBPM.
  • Cloud development experience in AWS, Azure would be highly desirable
  • Enthusiasm and experience working in Agile environments, particularly continuous delivery
  • Team player, fun, outgoing and passionate about high-quality code
Previous experience in Wealth Management is a bonus!

You'll need to possess a passion for technology and a work portfolio that reflects this.

This role will bring you a lot of satisfaction and will allow you to develop your career. You will need to have a passion for technology and a work history that illustrates a strong direction aimed at career growth.

Must have PR or NZ citizenship.

Note: Chelmer will not accept any unsolicited CV’s or any external applications for this position.

Note: We review all CV's manually and you will only be contacted if your skills and experience meet the requirements of any of our clients.

name: UI / UX Designer

description:

Here at BNZ, it's about more than just banking. We work together in an agile, energising environment to create innovative solutions that won't just help our customers be good with money, but also do great things with it.

We are looking for a Developer to help create our Digital banking applications, deliver new and innovative features to give our customers a great banking experience. This is a 12 month fixed term opportunity.

You will deliver a range of software applications/development services through design, development, programming, testing and maintenance of technology solutions aligned with business objectives. This includes:

  • Experience in using source control tools like Git, SVN
  • Experience with Integration technologies
  • Understanding of or Competent Agile practitioner, not just following practices, but translating principals into action
  • Proven ability to communicate ideas and designs clearly and concisely
  • Keen to learn and be mentored by others

Nau mai ki te Pēke o Aotearoa |Working at BNZ

At BNZ, we're passionate about building and sustaining a high-performance culture that motivates our people to deliver exceptional results. We know that every BNZer is unique, with a wide range of goals, ambitions, and lifestyles, so we offer a wide range of benefits and working styles to suit you.

  • Wellbeing: Your wellbeing is important to us. When we're at our best, physically and mentally, in and out of work, we can truly create great things together. We're here to support you to be your best with a number of wellbeing initiatives.
  • Leave: We all need a bit of time off every now and then. At BNZ we're proud to offer the generous leave options you need and deserve - whether it's for a special occasion, an unexpected event, or an extended vacation.
  • Flexibility: We're big on helping you balance life and work. We offer a range of flexible working options that help you be your best, wherever you're based. Talk to us about how we can make this work for you.


Haere mai ki Te Peke o Aotearoa | Come to the Bank of New Zealand

name: Senior Cadwork Detailer
description:
Offsite Design Ltd are experts in off-site manufacture of timber buildings offering unique design, engineering, and drafting services to prefabricators, contractors, and developers to help build the timber buildings of tomorrow. From tiny house, family homes to medium-rise, residential and commercial projects. Domestic and overseas clients.
Our specialist services include: DfMA (Design for Manufacture and Assembly), 3D fabrication modelling, 2D shop drawings, and file-to-factory export to drive CNC equipment and the factory.

Timber construction and prefabrication are experiencing strong interest in New Zealand, Australia and beyond, e.g. CAD/CAM integrated fabrication processes are being introduced, panelised prefabrication is taken up by small and large companies, cross- and parallel-laminated timber (CLT and PLT) are produced locally at scale.
A severe housing shortage in Auckland, and general productivity, affordability, and sustainability issues in the industry demand an alternative approach to construction. Prefabrication and timber buildings are increasingly seen as solutions to these challenges.
Offsite Design Ltd are actively involved in these trends and we are keen to hire senior Cadwork detailers from October 2020.

Responsibilities
  • Production of 3D models and 2D drawings supporting the prefabrication and construction of a variety of timber buildings, from small family home to medium rise/multi-storey.
  • Modelling of light timber frame (LTF) panelised residential buildings for fabrication, incl. services.
  • 2D drafting/detailing of factory and assembly documentation.

Your experience and skills
  • In-depth knowledge and experience (min 5 years) of Cadwork.
  • Hands-on experience of construction and prefabrication of timber buildings (e.g Zimmererlehre, apprenticeship...).
  • Advanced experience using CADWORK , incl Element Module, machine export, etc.
  • Self-starter, with energy, passion, and genuine interest and exposure to timber construction.
  • Attention to detail and pride in your work.

We offer
  • A wide variety of projects across the whole range of engineered timber products and building typologies; from tiny house to multi-storey engineered timber structure.
  • Work at the leading edge of timber prefabrication and offsite manufacture in this part of the world, including involvement in R&D projects moving the industry forward.
- Work and Play in the outdoor paradise #1 of the south pacific - New Zealand.
  • A diverse and friendly team of individuals with a passion for building with wood, raising the quality of our built environment and the productivity of our industry.
  • Remuneration according to your skill set and experience.
Contact
Johann Betz
www.offsitedesign.co.nz

name: Product Designer
description:
Optimal Workshop is in the business of doing things differently. We have created a UX platform of tools designed to help our customers craft better human experiences across the world. Locally, we look to craft better day to day experiences through how we work together, our work environment and our company culture. In our mind - the tried and true is something to be built upon and improved.
We are currently looking for a Product Designer to come and join us in creating the future. If a collaborative work environment, supportive and flexible work culture and a product offering that is trying to change the world sounds exciting to you - read on!

We would be really keen to have a chat if you have:
  • 2+ years of professional experience in a collaborative design or tech environment;
  • an ability to work collaboratively with developers on projects;
  • expert eyes for detail;
  • strong written and oral communication and presentation skills;
  • a strategic and curious mindset;
  • a love for all things UX;
  • an appreciation of A/B testing and talking to customers to inform design decisions;
  • a proactive approach to your work;
  • a desire to grow in your discipline by seeking constructive feedback and providing it in return; and front-end and design system experience.
On any given day you could be:
  • introducing and maintaining a UX/UI workflow;
  • building interface templates as part of a new design system;
  • turning visions, strategic requirements and insights into concepts;
  • working alongside our UX writer for UX and UI concepts;
  • prototypes testing with our customers;
  • creating guidelines for scope and acceptance criteria;
  • designing delightful and usable interfaces to align with the product vision
  • exporting assets for implementation;
  • ensuring implemented assets look great and function properly;
  • facilitate co-designs with key stakeholders; and
  • document all processes and work.
SaaS and accessibility experience preferred but not essential. Ultimately, we are looking for an amazing person first - not just a list of bullet points. In exchange for your skills and awesomeness, we will provide you with the tools you need, the work environment you crave, the best colleagues, professional development and a smorgasbord of office dogs to pat.

Our customers are global, our industry is exciting and our product is designed to create better human experiences all over the world. This role can be whatever you want to make of it - the potential is huge! Do not delay in getting in touch with a cover letter, C.V and Troy Hammond from Talent Army will be in touch.
