  • Apply using the Apply button on this page

Who are we?
Sourced is a specialist IT Recruitment Agency primarily focused on permanent & contract positions within the Christchurch IT market.

Jobseekers come back to us time after time as we look out for them and provide sound, unbiased guidance throughout their careers. Our clients keep coming back because we do what we say we’ll do, working to genuinely understand their business, their culture and their unique dynamic. Keep up to date with all that is happening in your local IT and Technology market by registering with us now at www.sourced.nz

Overseas and New Zealand bound?
We work with candidates from all over the globe, every day. If you have made your decision to move to New Zealand and your plans are firmly underway, please get in touch by registering with us. We have clients who are sourcing specialised IT disciplines and are ready and willing to talk to you.

name: Product Manager  Job Description
description:
PikPok is looking for a passionate Product Manager to join our world beating
mobile game dev team!

We’re PikPok, New Zealand’s longest standing game developer, and we make great game experiences. We

want to create and entertain, while being successful and enjoying what we do, and we’re looking for people

who want that too. Over the years, we’ve built loads of games for all sorts of platforms, most recently titles

like Rival Stars Horse Racing on Android and iOS as well as A gent Intercept on Apple Arcade. Our teams are
small, and everyone involved can contribute to the decisions that shape the products.

PikPok is looking for a talented, motivated and passionate individual to take on the role of Product Manager

delivering globally successful games on digital platforms like mobile, PC, social or web. You’ll be responsible

for supporting the team as they develop, launch and drive ongoing updates of our games to expand PikPok’s

portfolio of innovative, original IP.

You love games!!! You’ll also have strong organisational & agile project management skills in the software

industry. You’re a great communicator & team player and can grasp new concepts quickly. You are

self-motivated and have confidence in dealing with complex and challenging situations. You care deeply about

our players and can help our teams to deliver beyond their expectations.

We welcome applications from diverse candidates and those with a range of backgrounds, skills, and

experiences.

Skills

  • 2+ years working in the mobile games industry in a leadership role
  • Strong working knowledge of established and trending free to play design strategies.
  • Extensive knowledge of the games market.
  • Direct agile development experience
  • Financial and analytical skills with expertise using common tools and documents (Budgets, P&L,

game/product design documents etc...)

  • Great organisational, motivational, negotiation and delegation skills with the ability to handle multiple
concurrent tasks, people, projects and responsibilities.
  • Strong customer focus and drive to deliver high quality games to end users

Responsibilities

  • Work with a product team consisting of game designers, programmers, artists and analysts to define,
understand and take ownership of driving the success of their title.
  • Act as the Product Owner to organize the product backlog and maximize the value that the team
produces each sprint through well crafted goals.
  • Define the roadmap to meet goals set by upper management, then communicate it to the
development teams and stakeholders.
  • Work with analytics to review and present findings from previous iterations of the products to
stakeholders.
  • Work with your Scrum Master and Leads to create an environment that supports high functioning
teams.

Contact

Please send your application along with a digital copy of your résumé/CV to: careers@pikpok.com. Additional
contact details can be found below and by visiting us online at www.pikpok.com

name: Senior .Net Developer
description:
You’re a leader by your actions. You have strong technical opinions, based on previous experience, but you hold them loosely and you’re open to change.

This company's culture and vision are central to who they are, pragmatic, curious, and innovative. They give you the room to grow, have an opinion with a mix of autonomy and true collaboration. They celebrate the differences in the team, and resonate strongly with their core value.

An early-stage startup, they are building out a SaaS platform, and have proven that they have a product/market fit. They are well funded, have healthy revenue, and a good sales pipeline to drive growth.

The stack:
The front end is a React app built with TypeScript. We use Apollo to consume our internal API. The back end is a GraphQL API built with .NET core, with a Postgres database.

The whole thing is hosted in containers on AWS, managed with Terraform, deployed with BuildKite and monitored in DataDog.

The team are now looking for a new senior .NET engineer to join an expanding, high performing team. You will need to have relevant engineering experience and bring a diversity of ideas and confidence to demonstrate your ideas and value.

Applications must be received online https://recruitcrm.io/apply/13392928

Application Deadline: 30/09/2020

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $80,000.00 – $125,000.00 per year

Experience:

  • .NET: 4 years (Preferred)

Work Eligibility:

  • No work eligibility and require sponsorship to work (e.g. Work to Residence visa) (Preferred)

name: Principal Solutions Architect
description:
To thrive in this roles it is anticipated that you will have:
  • In depth experience with the design and implementation of distributed applications
  • Experience with modern cloud architectures
  • Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.)
  • A background in software development tools and methodologies with experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT projects
  • A drive to deliver the best outcome for your customer that goes beyond their expectations

Come build the future with us! We are a company of builders with diverse backgrounds, ideas and points of view who invent on behalf of our customers.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated technologists who possess a unique balance of technical depth, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills. Following an internal move, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to join our Architecture team as a trusted advisor to iconic New Zealand brands who are leading the field in SaaS solutions on AWS.

As a trusted customer advocate, the Principal Solutions Architect will work to understand their business needs and provide guidance and best practices on how to leverage cloud technologies to solve these with innovative solutions. The ability to connect technology with measureable business value and help customers solve problems is critical to a solutions architect. You will represent AWS in face-to-face meetings and own the overall technical relationship between AWS and the customer up to C-level.

It is expected you will have a strong understanding of large scale computing solutions and experience leading deep architecture discussions. You must be self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges and have a passion for educating, training, and designing cloud solutions for enterprise customers. Software will be your thing and though you may only dabble in hands on coding now you will have a development background to call on and remain committed to curiosity around technology and its evolution.

With a diverse team, flexible work environment and a fantastic culture this is a role where you can take ownership and have a meaningful impact.

This role can be based in either Auckland or Wellington.


In addition to the above it would be great if you have:
  • Technical degree; Computer Science or Math background desired,
· Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies · Experience architecting or operating solutions build on AWS or other public cloud platform
  • Experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or technical consulting
  • Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud

“Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.”

name: Senior Community Developer Systems level C++/Rust
description:
Why you would like it:

  • A chance to be paid to do what you love - foster Community!

  • Enjoy solving complex problems or prototyping?

  • Unique combo of thought leadership and technical knowledge sharing

The role:

As a Senior Community Developer you will foster and grow an active community of developers who are able to contribute to the ongoing success of Centrality's technology by building solutions in CENNZnet.

If you are a natural thought leader, supporter of people and enjoy interacting with the developer community and catalysing innovation, then is one of those rare opportunities where you will be paid to do just that!

Any given week you could see yourself presenting at external meetups/conferences, writing compelling blog posts, creating bug bounty programs and the list goes.

But wait...

You can also get your hands dirty too :)! You will also contribute to product architecture, help review code, uphold open source standards prototype with community members etc...

Company profile:

You will most likely know Centrality for bringing together the brightest minds locally and internationally in the decentralised systems space. Since then they have continued to build out a compelling decentralised technology platform that is now open source and has an ecosystem of dApps on it already.

The skillset:

  • Senior level experience with:

    • Strong C++ with a willingness to adopt Rust (or hands on Rust experience would be ideal!)

    • Should be capable of providing feedback and discussion around ideal architecture

    • CI/CD experience, pipelines builds etc

    • Good understanding and experience with Automated testing approaches

  • Evidence of community development and engagement - blogs, post, commits etc

  • Ideally some evidence of contribution to open source projects

If you are an open minded, supportive, motivated and practical Software Engineer with a particular love for open source communities, then this role will be for you.

Send us your CV or if you meet the brief above and would like to ask some questions before applying, give Sam Nowell a call on 021673467.


  • Kaylee Robinson Executive Recruitment Assistant
  • kaylee@potentia.co.nz

name: Senior Dynamics 365 CRM Consultant
description:
Some of NZ’s largest and diverse Dynamics CRM projects with an award winning, Enterprise IT Solutions organisation based in Auckland City outskirts.

Within this role, you will work with an existing team of D365 Developers and Consultants and will have the opportunity to be very customer facing while providing pre-sales solutions followed by end to end implementations and deployments of D365 CRM.

Along with a great base salary, you will gain additional Kiwisaver, flexibility in much of your working and super opportunities to evolve your knowledge and technical capability aligned to MS products.
The skills that will encourage success in your application include:

  • MS Dynamics CRM – at least 5yrs commercial experience to include operating as a Functional expert
  • Functions – completion of multiple end to end implementations of D365 CRM / CRM upgrades / Rebuilds of D365 CRM / Workshop Facilitation / CRM Solution Design & Build
  • CRM Modules – essentially require Sales Service & Marketing).
  • Customer Engagement (crucial) – being very much a Consultant in that you work very closely with the end customers and have experience in engaging with Senior Management teams and decision makers.
  • Other (not essential but worth knowing) – any experience with other Dynamics 365 suite such as ERP (AX, BC, NAV)

We are really keen to commence the interview process ASAP and can happily bring the selected individual aboard at short notice (we are aware that you likely have an existing 4 weeks notice period).

PLEASE NOTE: Due to NZ border restrictions, we are unable to sponsor Visa’s and as such, we will only accept applications from either individuals already in NZ or returning NZ Residents and Citizens.

name: Senior Security Cloud Consultant
description:
• Can be based in Auckland or Wellington
New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments. We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion. We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.
About the role
We're excited about the transformative journey we are on and the benefits we'll see in migrating our on-premise applications and data to the public cloud. As a Senior Security Cloud Consultant your key focus will be to secure our cloud environment by working with our delivery teams on the security design and development of solutions to meet business and client needs, ensuring the use of appropriate security tools and frameworks. You'll be an active and influential member of our high performing agile team and you'll provide thought leadership to contribute to the maturity of our DevSecOps functions. Getting involved with early design of applications, you'll use products like Checkpoint, Fortinet, RedShield, Amazon Detective, AWS IAM Access Analyser and Azure Security Centre to create robust solutions that keep our applications and data secure.
About you
Naturally you'll need demonstrated knowledge of the core principles of Enterprise Security techniques and technology, and the ability to work within Agile and DevSecOps environments. Our ideal candidate will be very technical, you will have started as a Developer (preferably within API and microservices) then moved into Engineering roles before following your interest toward security. You will need to bring your learnings and successes of previous cloud migrations from on-prem to cloud and you'll have proven experience with Identity and Access Management Solution, Auth0 or OKTA.
A willingness to pitch in and get in on the action to get the job done is a must, along with your flexible, agile, resilient mindset and the ability to focus on multiple business initiatives at the same time.
Interested?
Can you bring energy and thought leadership to our relentless pursuit for continuous improvement? If you answered yes and have the skills and experience we are looking for, we invite you to apply now. We are only accepting applications via www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter. For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz
Applications close 4 October 2020. We will be reviewing applications regularly and may close the advertising period early.
All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and may be required to undertake a drug test and credit check.

name: UX/UI Designer - Wellington or Christchurch based opportunit...
description:
Kaihoahoa UX/UI [Wheako kaiwhakamahi/Atanga kaiwhakamahi]
About Us | Mō mātou
At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.

The role | Mō te tūnga

As part of the Customer Experience unit, the UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing UX/UI skills to ensure we understand the customer during the process of product development (e.g. website, data tools). You will be working with Senior UX/UI designers, content designers and a product owner who have a strong focus on making things easier for our customers.
The UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing a solid understanding of the customer through research and testing products. With an increasing demand from our customers to improve the way we deliver our products, the UX/UI Designer will provide key evidence to support decision-making during the product development process. The UX/UI designer will help build relationships across the organisation.
This is a very exciting time to be joining our team and be part of wider changes within the organisation. No two days will be the same in this influential and critical role in better understanding customer needs.
Focusing on development projects and shaping methods that will ensure a better customer experience, the UX/UI Designer will:
  • work closely with Customer Experience teams to support a range of initiatives
  • provide expertise on projects that will improve our products for our customers
  • assist with customer testing and research that will be the source of truth for best practice across the organisation
  • be the voice of external customers and work alongside others within the organisation to create success in what we deliver * engage with customers to understand their needs and requirements
  • embrace opportunities to work with other parts of the organisation, seeking opportunities to embed UX best practice * work closely with other relevant UX experts across government to foster collaboration and governance
Starting salary: $63,000 - $71,000 negotiable depending on the skills and experience of the successful applicant.
, About you | Mōu

To succeed in this role, you will:
  • be familiar with research methods using a variety of user research and testing methods to reveal customer insights
  • have a good understanding of product development and user testing methodologies
  • have great communication and relationship management skills with both working with customers and influencing stakeholders * be able to maintain a strong customer focus and understanding to inform development
  • share learnings and developing best practice to support the organisation
  • work in an agile development environment with analysts, designers, developers, and software teams to create customer-focused products and services.
Desired skills:
  • Have experience working in service design and/or working in a service design environment
  • Ability to work proactively within a team environment and take on new challenges with ease
  • Ability to help build consensus and facilitate discussions
How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono

If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/3kxGzfI into your browser.

Any questions that haven t been answered in this advert or the position description or if you have difficulty with your application please email jobs@stats.govt.nz.

We will be screening applications as we receive them in order to move swiftly to interview shortly after the advert closes on date. Note to Recruitment Agencies: unsolicited CVs will not be accepted.

You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job.

Applications close Thursday 8 October 2020.

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The Company

Seequent is a world leader in the development of geoscience software. We have employees in 17 locations across 6 continents and we are currently active in four key industries: Environment, Mining, Civil Engineering & Energy.

Our solutions enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological, geophysical and geotechnical data, and ultimately make better decisions about their subsurface challenges.

We’re geologists, geoscientists, software engineers, salespeople and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are motivated by the challenges our customers face. We use the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work towards the bigger solutions of tomorrow.

We challenge ourselves, creating innovative solutions to dynamic problems, and we work hard to inspire positive change across the globe. We’re interested in changing the way people work, and we’re not scared of big ideas.

The Role

To support the rapid growth of our business, we are seeking a highly motivated Senior Software Engineer to join our Christchurch team. This is a fulltime permanent role based in Christchurch.

Working closely with other developers, Product Owners, DevOps engineers and Cloud Operations staff, you will be a key member of our development team building our world class products. If you are looking for a technical challenging role developing quality software, then Seequent is for you.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Solve technically challenging problems
  • Flex your debugging muscles
  • Experience working with a team of like-minded developers
  • Unleash your design flair
  • Champion the cause of great software

In order to be successful in this role, you will have:

  • An interest in science
  • Excellent collaboration skills
  • Brilliance, motivation, and pragmatism, to work in a highly technical environment
  • A high level of experience in modern coding practices and designs
  • Adaptability – we develop cloud, enterprise and Windows desktop applications using open-source tools; can you keep up

Technology we utilise:

  • Microsoft Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, Datadog, Sentry[JD1]
  • Ansible, Terraform, PowerShell
  • Python, TypeScript, ReactJS, Redux, Qt, C/C++[JD2]
  • SQLite, PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ
  • Windows (Windows Services, IIS), Linux

Tools we prefer:

  • PyCharm, Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio
  • Atlassian Suite (JIRA, Confluence, etc), Github
  • Azure DevOps, TeamCity

Techniques we believe in:

  • Lean/Agile
  • In-team domain experts
  • Continuous Improvement

Why you will enjoy working with us..

Seequent offers a flexible and supportive team environment, including medical insurance, relocation assistance, an on-site gym, flexible hours and a Christchurch office located right next to Hagley Park. We also provide ongoing learning and personal growth opportunities.

Inclusion + Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience.
If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please provide details in your cover letter of any accommodations needed.

How to apply

If this sounds like the role for you, apply today with a covering letter and CV.

name: Senior Product Designer
description:
About the role

We're growing and are looking to hire a Senior Product Designer to join our modern offices in Auckland CBD. The Senior Product Designer will take ideas and grow them into fully functional software, informed by a deep knowledge of customer problems and driven by a passion for making beautiful, easy to use and useful products. If you want to work on exciting projects and work alongside a passionate team of designers, developers and product managers in a fast-moving collaborative environment - apply online today!


About Cin7

Cin7 is a fast-growing SaaS company with a global customer base across 25 countries. We’re passionate about making great products available to everyone. Every month, millions of sales orders flow through our platform reducing costs, effort and time for our customers. This means they can quickly and effectively get their products to their customers, and build their brands, all without worrying about their operations.


We’re also passionate about reducing the cost, time and effort of selling products. We know that connecting channels, inventory and accounting dramatically reduces costs and opens up exciting new opportunities for product sellers. Cin7 Inventory Management & Supply Chain software helps businesses manage their stock, purchasing, shipping, and sales, all in one central system.


Our team is friendly, collaborative and inclusive. We focus on bringing our best every day in a fast-paced customer focused environment. Comprehensive health insurance, flexible working and customer volunteer days are just a few of the benefits we provide along with discounted gym membership, birthdays off, and fresh fruit every day. Learn more at https://www.cin7.com/company/careers/.


Responsibilities:

  • Work in collaboration with product and engineering teams to create valuable and delightful products through excellent UX and UI design.
  • Help product teams implement design thinking through the product development lifecycle.
  • Maintain consistency across the platform through design systems.
  • Undertake qualitative and quantitative user experience research.
  • Create workflow diagrams and user journey maps etc. to document findings.
  • Create low-fidelity wireframes to rapidly prototype product ideas.
  • Create high-fidelity mockups as front-end specification for engineers.

Requirements

We are looking for a Product Designer with a broad spectrum of skills, from user research through to high-fidelity wireframing.


You will be a strong design leader, willing to inspire and communicate the value of the design process to the rest of the team.


The ideal candidate will have:

  • 5+ years working as Product Designer, UX Designer or similar for a B2B SaaS software company
  • A strong portfolio of work that shows both the design process and a modern visual aesthetic
  • Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods and tools (canvases, personas etc), and the ability to engage with customers in person or remotely to gain insight and feedback.
  • Business acumen, with a strong interest in creating products that are valuable to both customers and the business.
  • An excellent communicator, able to articulate ideas and decisions to a variety of stakeholders, and provide constructive critiques.
  • A strong understanding of design across mobile, tablet and desktop.
  • Mastery of design and prototyping tools such as Figma or Sketch and Invision.
  • An understanding of the development process, its limitations and possibilities.
  • Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture.
  • Problem-solving aptitude.
  • Degree in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent relevant experience.
  • Seeks to continually improve in everything they do via development opportunities and sharing of knowledge.
  • Independently able to complete tasks assigned and ask for suggestions when roadblocks occur.

Bonus Points:

  • Knowledge of inventory control, retail systems or other business functions
  • Experience with building design systems and styleguides, using tools like Storybook.
  • Knowledge of or interest in frontend development

Please submit or link to a portfolio of work on application.


Must currently living be in New Zealand and have the right to work in New Zealand.

name: Senior Business Analyst
description:
• Join one of New Zealand’s largest technology shops, with the opportunity to work across a large and diverse set of initiatives and technologies.
  • Showcase your banking industry and complex systems experience to help design and refine customer centric solutions.
  • Mentor and develop Business Analysts in elicitation, automation, scrum, and agile.

About The Role

As a Senior Technology Business Analyst you will be responsible helping to deliver business analysis functions across medium to high complexity initiatives for ANZ’s Markets and Treasury business. Initially this role will be focussed on embedding solutions to meet BS11 Requirements.

In this role, you would have the opportunity to:

  • Apply your business analysis skills and techniques to understand, validate and articulate business problems, opportunities, requirements, options and solutions.
  • Work with a range of business and technical stakeholders to deliver outcomes and value for our internal and external customers
  • Contribute to the analysis of business and stakeholder requirements to define detailed functional and non functional solution requirements to support development or make a solution decision
  • Contribute in breaking down initiatives into smaller increments
  • Apply your natural eye on identifying opportunities to deliver customer centric benefits.
  • Help to deliver our roadmap across a range of specialist technology areas with a focus on continuous improvement.
  • Contribute to estimation of effort and duration based on high level needs/requirements in conjuction with other squad members
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis

Role Location: Wellington
Role Type: Permanent
Hours: Standard business hours with flexible work options available

About You

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

  • Minimum 5+ years business analysis experience and a minimum 2+ years experience in an Agile/Scrum environment.
  • Excellent analytical, strategic, conceptual thinking skills to be able to solve complex problems using a range of techniques.
  • A proven track record as a Senior Business Analyst working on Technology solutions preferably in the Wholesale Banking and Markets area.
  • Exposure to or experience with complex system environments and interface mapping.
  • Proven experience capturing and managing requirements.
  • Proven experience of operating within Agile practices. You will have an adaptable approach, with a hands on, team focused mind-set.
  • Proven experience in the creation of user stories, acceptance criteria and specification by example.
  • Participator and facilitator of relevant Agile ceremonies and rituals: backlog refinement, daily Stand-up, iteration/release planning, showcases/sprint review, retrospective
  • Exceptional organisational and analytical skills with the ability to work to tight deadlines.
  • Well-developed relationship building skills and demonstrated ability to build rapport with and influence key stakeholders.
  • Excellent communication skills and a ‘team player’ attitude. You will be spending your day working alongside other business analysts, developers, testers and product owners and you will need to be able to communicate complex issues and be good at asking hard questions at the right time.

Although not essential, exposure to JIRA and Confluence is advantageous.

Some of our other benefits include:

  • Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave
  • Staff Banking and Insurance benefits
  • Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career
  • Southern Cross Health Insurance

To find out more about what it is like to work in ANZ’s Technology team watch this short video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6ccJeITDTc&feature=youtu.be&fbclid=IwAR0laTpfWblMpT3vKZMqMOEleQpRwKOEJZvrS4KnQYou6Y8k_qkdtOZBxms

About ANZ

Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.


ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.


The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.


Integrity – We are honest and fair

Collaboration – We work together for the customer

Accountability – We take ownership and get things done

Respect – We care for all those we serve

Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better


We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.


ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world;



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aP5k74hROfw&feature=youtu.be

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit http://www.anz.co.nz/careers


Applications close Tuesday 6th October.


Please note, because of the urgency of this role and current COVID-19 related NZ Border restrictions, applications will only be considered from those that are currently in NZ and have a current, indefinite and unrestricted right to work in New Zealand.

** No sponsorship or visa support can be provided at this time. **

name: Project Manager - Construction - East Coast - 12 month fixed...
description:
Project Manager - Construction - East Coast - 12 month fixed term or secondment

Ministry of Social Development
12 month fixed term or secondment, full time

Hawke's Bay District has significant build projects in development across the region over the next 2 years. These projects will require a skilled and trained local workforce.
We have an exciting opportunity for a Project Manager who will be responsible for developing an employment and training pipeline for these projects. A pipeline that connects local employers with future employees.
You will play a pivotal role working with public and private sector property developers to determine the look of the future build programme in Hawke's Bay. This information will then help to inform our regional decisions on the training, upskilling and employment of our current and future workforce.
Applicants with Project Management experience are encouraged to apply, a background in the construction or infrastructure sector is preferred.

Qualities of the successful candidate are:
  • 2yrs relevant project management experience
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • A good understanding of the construction and/or infrastructure sector within HB
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a diverse group of stakeholders
  • Able to meet project deadlines
How to apply:
  • Current MSD employees - please apply from a work computer, using your work myHR login. A current CV and cover letter is required.
  • All external applicants - please apply through the apply button and upload your CV and cover letter to our applicant tracking system. Please note all applications must be made online.
If you have any queries, please contact Polly Heke on polly.heke001@msd.govt.nz

Applications Close: 30 September 2020

Joining us
Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with Māori, Hapū, Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.
If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.

name: Senior Oracle Developer
description:
We are seeking a Senior Oracle Developers, to join a delivery focused team in the Wellington Public Sector. You must be able to work both collaboratively and self-directed in an agile software and systems delivery organisation.

The Role:
Working with the in-house team and outsourced providers, Senior Software Developers are accountable for technical design, development, unit test and maintenance of core applications. You will be joining a high-performing team who work in a collaborative manner with a continuous improvement mindset.

Key responsibilities:
  • Work with in-house teams and our vendors to ensure Development services are on time and to agreed quality standards.
  • Delivery of technical leadership in software development to meet Business as Usual requirements as well as supporting Programmes/Projects of work and major cyclic work.
  • Provide hands-on approach to implement unit test framework automation
  • Development of technical specifications and other necessary documentation
  • Improve team knowledge base and provide technical leadership in software development technique and continuous integration.
  • Provide technical analysis and advice to support development and testing teams, work independently and collectively in the evaluation and design of new services as well as support current applications and systems.

Must haves:
  • 5+ years’ experience as in Oracle development
  • Demonstrable experience in:
o Oracle Database (11g+ preferred, but open)
o SQL and PL/SQL
o Forms and Reports
o Root Cause Analysis and Tuning
o Bitbucket / git or other like version control systems
o Jenkins / Service Now
o Automated testing
  • Positive, collaborative attitude to get stuck in and always make improvements
  • The ability to build strong relationships with key stakeholders and team members.
  • Understanding of IT practices and frameworks including Systems Development Life Cycle
  • Recent experience working in an Agile team.

Desirable experience / nice to haves:
  • Experience with Ascender or Alesco
  • C# / json / groovy / API experience
Applications for this position will be strictly managed through via our tracking system.

To register your interest for these positions, please ensure that you are only applying for this role via the ‘Apply Now’ Portal. If you require further information, please reach-out to Kane (Kane.Landers@h2r.co.nz)

name: Principal Software Engineer
description:
• Initial 12 month FTE contract with possibility to extend or become Permanent
  • Senior Leadership role with a flexible working component
  • Progressive and dynamic company culture, professional development opportunities and work-life balance!

ABOUT THE COMPANY

Our client is a well-established geospatial solutions company with a demonstrated history of delivering strategic consulting and geospatial solutions to their clients.

ABOUT THE ROLE

You will be required to provide leadership in the area of enterprise application development. You will work with developers, solutions managers, solutions architects, and clients. This role has a hands-on component but its main focus is to lead the existing Development Team and deliver exceptional solutions to external clients which will call upon your extensive software engineering and software development experience, your passion for technology and the latest thinking in terms software engineering, development, design and architecture and your ability to communicate, lead and mentor strategically.
Code reviews are a reponsibility of this role so you must be comfortable and keen to do this on a daily basis, at the same time the preparation of proposals, new innitiatives and technologies are also key components of this varied role.


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Outstanding communication and relationship management skills
  • At least 10 years commercial experience in software engineering
  • Experience leading and mentoring a software development team
  • Experience working directly with external clients as a Senior Consultant whilst maintaining and nurturing existing relationships
  • Experience with the development and implementation of enterprise applications solutions
  • Experience with Agile methodologies, in particular SCRUM
  • Experience with the some or all of the following:
    • AWS/Azure
    • Microservices architecture
    • C#/.Net/.Net Core, ASP.Net (MVC), JavaScript
    • Frameworks such as Angular, Xamarin, React, Leaflet, Bootstrap
    • SQL DB (SQL Server, Oracle, PostGIS, PostgreSQL)

COMPANY CULTURE

A professional and sociable office environment within an innovation driven company. This organisation is still going strong throughout COVID-19 and is very focused on its employees well-being.


How to apply

Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Franco Carli on 093027023.

NOTE to overseas enquiries and non-NZ residents:
Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions. Others may not necessarily be responded to.

name: Senior Analyst Developer - Fixed Term
description:
About Us | Mō mātou
At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.

The role | Mō te tūnga

Due to parental leave we have the opportunity for a Senior Analyst Developer to join the Digital Business Solutions team for a 12 month term.

As the Senior Analyst Developer, you will have a passion for craftsmanship and thrive on being in an environment where you can learn and adapt, trying out new technologies and collaborating with others to continually improve our DevOps journey within the organisation.
You will enjoy working in a small team using agile practices and be active in contributing to software design and software practices. You will be innovative and be able to challenge status quo to ensure continual improvement occurs. You will also be involved in:

  • Building and supporting our core API, user interfaces, and backend processing systems. * Integrate our systems with Vendor provided software.
  • Develop high performance and reusable software with excellent test coverage. * Identify automation opportunities to improve DevOps operations. * Agile and SCRUM * Experience working with data lake environment, such as Cloudera or Databricks
  • Proactive reporting of progress on work assignments (including delays) to appropriate managers
  • Web development using React, ES6 and Typescript * Scripting languages such as PowerShell and Python * Source Code Management tool such at Git and TFS * Test Driven Development and Behaviour Driven Development
About you | Mōu

Within your application please provide your skills and experience with the following:

  • Agile and SCRUM * Experience working with data lake environment, such as Cloudera or Databricks
  • Knowledge of different database systems, such as RDBS, NoSql
  • Ability to work in Linux and windows operation systems
  • Experience in coding, testing and development of backend systems
  • Knowledge of functional and object-oriented programming
  • Knowledge/familiarity with the DevOps model, in-house standards, and best practice
  • A proven ability to establish collaborative relationships within team and with business
  • Proactive reporting of progress on work assignments (including delays) to appropriate managers
Some experience or skills in the following would be desirable:
  • Web development using React, ES6 and Typescript * Scripting languages such as PowerShell and Python * Source Code Management tool such at Git and TFS * Test Driven Development and Behaviour Driven Development
, What s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe
You ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. This includes:

  • Opportunity to develop and grow your career
  • Balance with life and work commitments
  • An environment that s safe, where you can be yourself
How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono

If you feel that your skills and experience are a good fit for this role, please click apply and upload your cover letter and CV.

To view the Position Description for this role, paste this link https://bit.ly/35FKl2p into your browser.

If you have questions please email jobs@stats.govt.nz.

Recruitment agencies please note, unsolicited CVs shall not be accepted.

Applications close: Sunday, 4 October 2020.
Applicants must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand in order to be considered for these roles.

name: Manawatu/Wanganui Branch & BD Manager
description:
We have a great opportunity for an experienced hands on client relationship developer to lead and grow our Palmerston North and Wanganui branches.

Our regional branches represent a key part of AWF's strategy to maintain its position as NZ's leading provider of labour hire and permanent placement services to key provincial centres throughout the country

This Palmerston North based position revolves around growing business in a competitive environment through development and execution of a sound sales plan, delivering first class service to clients and candidates alike, leading and driving a team and operating within the risk management parameters of the company as a whole.

Ideally we'd like you to have a good understanding of the local economy, the people and the down to earth patriotic nature we have in this part of the world. And some sound exposure to multiple business sectors including manufacturing, logistics, roading/infrastructure and engineering.

The focus is on sales and people - both our clients and candidates and your team

You will:

Lead by example, supporting and motivating your small team

Seek out, win and maximise sales within existing customers, but also through growth of our client base

Exceed financial targets

Promote company driven key initiatives with a local flavour

Ensure Health & Safety compliance is maintained - to both company and client standards

In this role you will be a critical part of driving the success of the Palmerston North and Wanganui branches. We require a self-motivator with focus and drive, who can juggle conflicting priorities, work smart to meet the demand, keep cool under pressure and provide solutions. We are people finding people for people, and everything that can go wrong sometimes does. You'll therefore need to be someone with resilience and a 'never say die' approach, providing exceptional service to both clients and candidates whilst also working within financial guidelines.

Experience running a successful small B2B business or a branch of a national entity will be highly regarded.

Interested in learning more? Please click on the apply now button. Or if you're really serious, pick up the phone and give Fleur Board, General Manager, a call on 0275 773068.

name: $86K OTE Sales Specialist - JOBID: ZR_5_JOB, SOURCE: IN-W-S-...
description:
WE ARE OPEN DURING LOCKDOWN

  • Remote working until lockdown is over.
  • Career Boost $50K base + $36K OTE & More
  • Join a High Achieving & Collaborative Workplace.
  • Travel Incentives: Work Hard, Play Hard! Bali, Thailand, Vietnam
  • Grow Your Sales Career in the Solar Industry with vibrant CBD location.
  • Travel Available - International Solar Conference
  • No Cold Calling - No outbound sales, All Inbound sales
  • FULL TRAINING PROVIDED

Step Up To A Sales Job That Matters
Are you a high achiever hungry to join a team of like-minded Sales Representatives? Want to step-up your sales career & join a team of career sales consultants? Are you looking for a sales position where you can make a real difference to the world? Joining our solar sales team offers all that & more.

You will be getting in on the ground floor of a growth industry. The renewables industry is now worth over $1.5 trillion per year to the World Economy. Billions are being invested into this new emerging & exciting industry globally. Get Your Slice Of The Action!

Solar employees over 3 million people worldwide. So if you are sick of selling for a tired and boring industry that is going nowhere. Then join the solar industry as the only place this industry is going - IS UP!

Solar Monster is a vibrant young company that’s committed to selling tomorrow’s products today. Want A Better Career & A Better World? Click Apply Now.

About the company
The Monster Group believes strong recruitment, drives strong results. We believe that recruiting, nurturing & growing staff is the key to success. Training is one of our Core Values, so we are seeking sales consultants who are ready to grow with us. This is a great opportunity for everyone involved. We want you to make money, and that makes us money! So come join a team that's already winning. We want you to help us win some more.

We are staffed with over 50 dynamic & hard-working sales representatives & marketers. Our company is driven by marketing, so we have a core focus on this industry as well. Our company has big dreams and is already looking at expanding into the booming California Solar Industry.

Our Motto Is To Think Fast, Implement Faster. You will be reporting directly to our sales executives who have a passion for sales and are great Sales Coaches.

Any decisions needed are often made the same day. Looking to free yourself from corporate bureaucracy & regain your sanity? Then this exciting & rewarding sales position is for you!

Our Core Values:

  • Love To Learn
  • Grab The Opportunities
  • Personally Responsibility
  • Enjoy Yourself
  • Customer Focus
  • Passion to Work

Our Story - A Team of Sales Specialists that Work!
Do you breathe sales? Want to excel your career fast with a collaborative & fun workspace? Fast-growing startup in Wellington? Interested in helping us Grow? We have Big Plans.

Since starting in 2015 Monster Group has grown rapidly through both hard work and a continuous drive for success. We focused on the Australian market in our start-up phase. Our continued growth looks bright with our entry into NZ. Our sales coordinator has built a culture that works & we’re only getting Bigger.

Our company continues to thrive in our field because of our unique working environment that excels with a collaborative approach to design, creation & then implementation. We’re also forward-thinking. Monster Group relies heavily on tech & digital marketing.

Our portfolio of brands we have recruited to work with continues to grow as our company expands. Keen to join our success-driven team and help us enter the New Zealand market?

Key Responsibilities:
Our Solar Sales Consultants do more than just sell, we’re looking for a committed customer service professional who loves nothing more than a happy & satisfied customer.

  • Educate our customers about the amazing benefits of Solar.
  • Develop & design the perfect solar system for our customers
  • Work in a team to hit our monthly sales targets.
  • Use your sales skills to close our online and TV leads.
  • Thrive in a target driven environment.

The skills we need in a Solar Sales Consultant
Think you’ve got what it takes to join our team of sales specialists? Here’s what we need from you.

  • Desire to WIN!
  • Proven experience in the sales arena
  • Think on your feet
  • Want to constantly improve processes
  • Clear and efficient phone manner.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Sense of Humour

What We Offer:
If you’re the right person for this position, we offer the following:

  • 50K Base + 36K OTE
  • Generous Bonuses + Holiday Incentives
  • Great Workplace Culture
  • Growing Innovative Business
  • Comfortable Wellington CBD

How To Apply:
If you have experience or have a keen interest to work in a unique and vibrant atmosphere, then we want to hear from you! In return for your efforts, you'll get to work in a fun and expanding industry. With a company that rewards success with Financial Rewards!

Please apply via the link with a cover letter and CV attached to complete your application.

name: General practice lawyer | South Auckland
description:
We are looking for a 2+ year level lawyer (those more experienced may be of interest too) to work in a friendly and collegial team where you'll be mentored by a partner, consultant and work alongside other lawyers and support staff in the areas of residential conveyancing transactions, commercial leasing, refinancing transactions, trusts, wills, estate administration, occupation right agreements and related general practice legal work.

You'll work with clients that are mainly private clients in providing advice in terms of their personal affairs, as well as small-medium sized businesses and private developer clients. You will be someone that is proactive and willing to get stuck in but will have senior level support from partners to guide you on more complex files.

There are good working hours so you'd have a life outside of work. While you'd be expected to provide a good servcie to clients, the firm doesn't have high billing targets or pressure in that regard.

The ideal person will have:

  • 2-4 years PQE in general practice and property work. Some NZ based private practice legal experience is a must;
  • An ability to build a rapport with clients and cultivate strong client relationships;
  • Good communication and problem solving skills.

This is a firm that has a steady stream of work, a long-standing and established diverse client base across Central, South and East Auckland. If you're looking for a move closer to home, or are looking for greater variety and mentorship, get in touch to find out more.

For further information, contact Anand Ranchhod on 027 2746 186 or email your CV and academic transcript to aranchhod@cobaltrecruitment.com, or click 'APPLY' now.

name: Senior Civil Engineer (Water) - Auckland
description:
17740BR

Requisition Number:

17740BR

Description:

Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind .

We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.

About the role

  • We are looking for a driven individual to step into the exciting and challenging role of Senior Waters Engineer in our Auckland (Newmarket) office.
  • You will be part of a dynamic team working closely with our clients throughout the wider Auckland region to deliver projects whilst enjoying the Auckland office culture which has a vibrant social club, exciting projects and great development opportunities.
  • This is an exciting opportunity for a professional engineer with a proven track record of successfully delivering projects to work collaboratively with our clients and colleagues across Asia Pacific. You will have a chance to work on projects from the initial investigation and detailed design right through to completion of construction.
  • You will work with a diverse client set from local government through to private developers.
  • You will join an Auckland team that works on infrastructure projects, not only locally, but across New Zealand and the wider Asia Pacific region.

Title:

Senior Civil Engineer (Water) - Auckland

Qualifications:

What you need to bring

  • Our preferred candidate for this role will have proven technical experience in general Civil Water engineering projects encompassing Waters infrastructure. (You will have the technical support of our extensive design resources based in New Zealand and the wider Asia Pacific area).
  • You will be experienced dealing with a range of clients and stakeholders including local authorities, government bodies and commercial companies.
  • In this exciting position, your own self-management skills will be as important as your technical and project management ones. You will need to be able to prioritise workloads whilst maintaining strong and trusting working relationships with our clients' and colleague's both locally and across the broader Stantec team.
  • You will be able to work with remote teams to deliver projects to local clients.
  • Key requirements are a BE Civil Engineering or equivalent, plus a minimum of 10 years professional experience in the consulting or engineering industry.
  • CPEng or equivalent is preferable.

Job Category:

Civil Engineering

Preferred Specifications:

What we offer

Along with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.

  • Flexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts
  • Learning and Talent Development Programs including global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
  • Mentoring for your own development
  • Professional Memberships
  • Health Insurance – Income Continuance Insurance (ICI) – Life Insurance
  • Service Recognition Awards
  • Employee Assistance Program

How to apply

Applications close on Friday 16 October 2020.

Please apply directly online.

No Agency CVs will be accepted.

About Stantec:

The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring water, transport and infrastructure projects to life. Our work from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a nearly 200-year history. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work.

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in the US thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, collaborative, innovative, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Why Software Engineering at Vacasa

Do you want to be part of an NZ team helping the largest vacation property management company in the US solve problems on a global scale? Are you excited to explore the benefits of scalability and performance by leveraging modern, cloud-based technologies? At Vacasa, we are constantly experimenting and fine-tuning our products. We value stability, security, and scalability.

What we are looking for

Vacasa is looking for passionate Senior Software Engineers for our fast-growing engineering organization. At Vacasa, we value team independence and ownership, rapid delivery and continuous improvement.

In this role, you would be part of a cross-functional team building scalable, cloud-native solutions to high-impact business problems. You'll be working with Node.js for back-end services and with React for front-end applications.

What you'll do with your team

As a Senior Software Engineer, you'll be a key member of your team, solving mission-critical problems and being a hands-on contributor to our ever-evolving systems. We believe to shine in this role, you're good at:

  • Designing, architecting, and building software; applying current technology thinking and patterns to our business problems
  • Guiding developers via code reviews, discussion and modeling of code that is easy to evolve and read
  • Continuously learning new technologies and validating concepts in order to pick the right tool for the job
  • Utilizing DevOps tools and practices for building, deploying, and maintaining software in production environments
  • Participating and building a collaborative, productive culture around product-focused goals
  • Building towards high quality standards and working with your team to create robust testing approaches

Skills you'll need

  • 5+ years of professional experience using two or more languages and working with multiple back-end data storage technologies
  • Ability to write high-quality, well-tested code that places maintainability over cleverness; know when and what to optimize for in a given situation
  • Adept at guiding technical direction within a cross-functional engineering team
  • Experience in cloud platforms with Infrastructure as Code
  • Experience and enthusiasm to mentor junior engineers

Nice to have

  • Completed a B.S./M.S. in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
  • Experience with React, Node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript
  • AWS Serverless tech
  • Mobile app development experience
  • Experience in hospitality or travel industry

Working with us has its benefits

  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Flexible work environment
  • A fancy new Macbook Pro
  • Great colleagues and culture

name: Senior Commercial Advisor - Commercial Viability
description:
About us | Mō mātou
The new Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is the Government's lead advisor on housing and urban development and will deliver the Government's programme to address homelessness, increase public and private housing supply, make existing homes warmer and healthier, make housing affordable for people to rent and buy, and lead quality urban development strategies to create thriving communities.
The Housing Supply, Response and Partnerships group leads work to address New Zealanders' housing needs both now and in the future. The group includes both policy and delivery-focused functions, providing advice to the Government on preventing and reducing homelessness, and funding the delivery of public housing, transitional housing, and housing related support services to tackle homelessness in New Zealand. The group works closely with other parts of HUD, and with HUD's partners, including Kāinga Ora – Homes and Communities, community and transitional housing providers, developers, social services, councils and other agencies.
About the role | Mō te tūnga
We are looking for a Senior Commercial Advisor will contribute to the provision of an effective delivery function for Public Housing Supply, while recognising other associated specialist services. By using robust and effective partnering principles and commercial models and reinforcing the shift we are making to have a strong value for money ethos. The role will be responsible for working closely with the Business Development Managers and external partners to support the delivery of new public housing supply.
About you | Mōu
You will have a strong commercial background with specialist experience working on residential property developments and initiatives. You will have significant experience in managing a broad range of stakeholder relationships in a fast paced, complex environment.
You will have experience providing commercial and financial advice to public and private sector clients in New Zealand, particularly in connection with social infrastructure projects (housing, education, correctional services), which includes commercial structuring and options appraisals, financial modelling and financial due diligence. We are looking for a professional who has experience in strategy development, financial options analysis and enterprise valuation.

Your experience will include:
  • Must have a strong background in residential property development and/or project management specific to construction/property development
  • Experience negotiating agreements relating to funding and/or leasing multi-unit property developments
  • Previous experience in data management – preferably financial monitoring experience
  • Demonstrated experience and knowledge in sourcing strategies within a large organisations
  • Proven ability in critical thinking, analysis and the development of business processes, operating manuals or policies
  • Preferably an understanding of relevant legislation, government and local government policies and processes relating to procurement and the public sector
  • Comfortable working within a fast moving and at times ambiguous, environment
  • Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, including development/construction plans
  • Understanding, experience or qualifications in urban design principles and building/resource consent processes
  • Understanding and experience of the stages involved in construction and land development
  • Understanding and experience of different building technologies and innovations (components and materials, modular or prefabrication design, building resilience).
How to Apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono
This is an exciting time to join our Ministry with a people focused mandate, and where you will be part of a team making a positive difference in the community.
Please click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to the application page. From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.
For any confidential enquires please feel free to contact Jo Attewell at jo.attewell@hud.govt.nz.
Applications close Wednesday 30th September 2020.
Please be advised that due to the Covid-19 virus some interviews may be held via Microsoft TeamMeet. HUD is keeping close watch on advice from the Ministry of Health, keeping our staff and candidate's safe is our top priority. Please do not hesitate to get in touch with our Talent Acquisition contact if you have any questions.
Please note, you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand to be eligible for this position.

name: QA Tester
description:
Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The QA Tester is responsible for the functional quality of a developed application. It is their job to identify all application defects prior to release to the client. This requires a true commitment to quality and an attitude of ownership of the Test stage.
What you’ll bring
  • An ability to work closely with multiple stakeholders including Product Manager and Bas
  • Efficiency and high quality outputs with low number of escaped defects
  • Quick and clear understanding of new development, identifying key areas of risk for testing
  • Ability to troubleshoot issues to understand whether they are config, data, or code related
Responsibilities
  • Provide input into the feature design stage, estimation and sprint planning
  • Actively monitor quality of functional testing, providing feedback to developers/dev lead/product manager throughout the development of product features
  • Work with the Business Analyst and/or Client to resolve gaps or ambiguities in the functional design
  • Ensure the Product manager is kept up to date, making them especially aware of any issues causing test delays
  • Develop & execute test plans against developed features and components. Identify and report defects, work with team to resolve
  • Configure, use and manage test data and environments in strict accordance with all internal and customer security standards
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

name: Senior Manager, Data Architect & Technical Manager
description:
The Covid-19 pandemic is creating seismic challenges around the world. Our purpose, to build a better working world, has never been more important. Life at EY has been transformed dramatically but our strong culture of flexible and remote working has helped EY people navigate new ways of working and remain connected with each other and our clients.

A better working world truly starts with the people at EY who are building it every day. Now more than ever we need talented people from diverse backgrounds to help our clients navigate the complexities of this Transformative Age: people with the passion, curiosity and drive to make things better.

The opportunity

We are seeking capable ambitious people to join our Data and Analytics practice to help us fulfil our EY purpose of Building a Better Working World.

EY’s DnA team has demonstrated success in delivering innovative solutions to clients across New Zealand and globally. Our growth in New Zealand is strong and we are continuing our work to build out team in Auckland a team that is bringing the very best of our data and analytics capabilities and offerings to the clients we serve in New Zealand.

Working in Auckland with our high-profile clients across both the public and private sectors, as a Senior Manager – Big Data Architect and Technical Delivery Lead, you’ll will work as part of a broader DnA, Advisory and EY teams develop your skills and to contribute to meaningful change for New Zealand and New Zealanders. We seek hard working, experienced and technically capable data professionals who are team players and who have ambition for themselves and the teams and clients they work with.
We are seeking people with experience of large and complex big data architecture, migrations and a good handle on core analytics and emerging technologies for this domain. Successful candidates will be client and service centric, will be experienced problem solvers and team leaders and ideally will have experience succeeding when facing significant delivery challenges or issues in the past.

We’re play and win as a team and love sharing knowledge and learning from each other every day. We have a strong focus on training including technical workshops, off site vendor training, lunch time knowledge sharing sessions and mentoring opportunities.

Your key responsibilities:
  • Big data platform architect and developer with expertise and experience using Azure Data Lake Store, Data Factory, Data Bricks and DevOps
  • Lead architecture and solutioning efforts to define and develop big data components
  • Analyse data growth and lead capacity/sizing activities to arrive at the most appropriate commercial and technical solution
  • Provide day to day technical leadership, management and mentorship to the junior members of the delivery team
  • Manage day to day interactions with client stakeholders as required to support the effective and efficient delivery of the project/initiative.
  • Assist with the planning, budgeting, and mobilisation of projects.
  • Translate complex technical concepts into simple communications which the business can understand.
  • Work collaboratively with other teams like data science and information architecture to create best fit solution for the clients
  • Previous experience working on large data engineering and migration programmes.
  • Previous experience working with data, data environments, databases, large data sets possibly in a consulting environment
  • Participate and lead the proposal development including the pricing strategy in line with the business’ processes
  • Strong problem solver, someone comfortable to challenge the status quo
  • Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills
  • Demonstrated resilience and adaptability
Ideally, you'll also have:
  • Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
  • Experienced in developing solutions focused on Big Data and Advanced analytics across diverse domains
We have a robust career framework within EY and this role will be the start point for many potential paths through a long and valuable career for the successful candidate.
What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your performance. In addition, our comprehensive Total Rewards package can be tailored to your individual needs, to give you the freedom to manage your role in a way that’s right for you. This includes;
  • a variety of flexible working and leave arrangements
  • personalised career development including coaching and support to help you build your career and access to formal learning so you can develop the skills you’ll need to thrive in the future
  • a range of tools and benefits to guide and support your health and wellbeing throughout your entire EY career.
About EY
At EY, we hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. Through our inclusive leadership behaviours, a variety of internal networks, flexible working and mentoring programs, you will have the support and flexibility to build an exceptional career.

EY is committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process for people with disability. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 1).

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process will be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Apply now.

#LI-EYNewZealand #LI-ANALYTICS

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider.

© 2019 Ernst & Young, New Zealand. All Rights Reserved.
