name: Senior Security Cloud Consultant
description:
• Can be based in Auckland or Wellington
New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments. We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion. We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.
About the role
We're excited about the transformative journey we are on and the benefits we'll see in migrating our on-premise applications and data to the public cloud. As a Senior Security Cloud Consultant your key focus will be to secure our cloud environment by working with our delivery teams on the security design and development of solutions to meet business and client needs, ensuring the use of appropriate security tools and frameworks. You'll be an active and influential member of our high performing agile team and you'll provide thought leadership to contribute to the maturity of our DevSecOps functions. Getting involved with early design of applications, you'll use products like Checkpoint, Fortinet, RedShield, Amazon Detective, AWS IAM Access Analyser and Azure Security Centre to create robust solutions that keep our applications and data secure.
About you
Naturally you'll need demonstrated knowledge of the core principles of Enterprise Security techniques and technology, and the ability to work within Agile and DevSecOps environments. Our ideal candidate will be very technical, you will have started as a Developer (preferably within API and microservices) then moved into Engineering roles before following your interest toward security. You will need to bring your learnings and successes of previous cloud migrations from on-prem to cloud and you'll have proven experience with Identity and Access Management Solution, Auth0 or OKTA.
A willingness to pitch in and get in on the action to get the job done is a must, along with your flexible, agile, resilient mindset and the ability to focus on multiple business initiatives at the same time.
Interested?
Can you bring energy and thought leadership to our relentless pursuit for continuous improvement? If you answered yes and have the skills and experience we are looking for, we invite you to apply now. We are only accepting applications via www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter. For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz
Applications close 4 October 2020. We will be reviewing applications regularly and may close the advertising period early.
All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and may be required to undertake a drug test and credit check.

name: Change Manager
description:
Become part of an exciting project where you will play a vital role of delivering change across New Zealand


Your new company
A leading agency is looking for a Change Manager to become a part of their Transformation and Change portfolio, who will play a critical part in delivering change across communities’ in New Zealand

Your new role
This role is a hands on, delivery focused role which guides, and influences change through the project delivery life cycle. You will be reporting to the Capability Manager, and ensure business readiness and the successful delivery of the organisations business outcomes.

Your main responsibilities as Change Manager will include:

  • Developing, owning and managing the stakeholder management, engagement and communications plans across the programme / project
  • Developing the change and transition plans and activities that need to take place
  • Identifying, developing and delivering change activities / interventions working with training developers and the business to achieve the change
  • Identifying activities to embed the process and system changes in the business
  • Measuring change effectiveness and identifying learning's across the work stream
  • Proactively addresses issues, looking for shared wins and outcomes

What you'll need to succeed
We are looking for an experienced leader, with considerable previous experience as a Change Manager. As a Change Manager, it is essential you take ownership and responsibility for delivering the Change and stakeholder management responsibilities within a programme or project.

What you'll get in return
You will have the opportunity to work in a rewarding environment, that is committed to your well being and development.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to catherine.vandermerwe@hays.net.nz

name: General Manager Operations
description:
General Manager Operations - Moffat

Reference Number: 7060aa

Location: Christchurch

  • Christchurch Based
  • Market Leading Global Group
  • Wide Ranging Senior Leadership Role

THE COMPANY:

The Moffat Group based in Australia is part of the leading global business the Ali Group. The Moffat Group are the Southern Hemisphere’s largest developer, manufacturer and marketer of a comprehensive range of commercial cooking, baking and meal distribution products for the hospitality and food service market worldwide. Moffat Limited (based in NZ) is the market leader in New Zealand, and with an impressive state of the art head office and manufacturing facility in Christchurch (Rolleston), Moffat market their products under their speciality brands, which include Blue Seal, Cobra, Turbofan, Fast Fri and Waldorf amongst others.

THE ROLE:

With the impending retirement of the long-serving incumbent, Moffat seek a new General Manager Operations to lead the Manufacturing, Research & Development, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain and Inventory, Procurement functions. Reporting to the Group Managing Director, this role will provide dedicated and motivational leadership to 5 direct reports and a wider team of approx. 120. The primary focus of this role is to provide strong leadership and direction for all operational activities. With quality control and meeting customer expectations a cornerstone of the role, you will develop and implement a strategic operational plan which also ensures the plant, facilities, equipment and personnel are effectively utilised to maximise efficiencies. The General Manager Operations will also work closely with managers across the business and assist the Group MD with all projects in order to optimise manufacturing and overall business performance.

THE PERSON:

Applicants will possess substantial experience in managing operations at a strategic level, ideally gained within a manufacturing environment, with an engineering related qualification also being highly desirable. Candidates for this role must have strong critical thinking skills coupled with exceptional leadership and people management capabilities. Success in this role will hinge on the ability to establish credibility and take complete ownership of all operational activities and assisting the management team to build on an already successful business.

Based at Moffat’s Rolleston office, this is a great leadership opportunity to work in a supportive and experienced, market-leading global organisation, further developing a committed team and interacting with every part of the business, managing and improving operations as you go.

To apply in strict confidence now, please complete the ‘apply for this job’ application form, attaching your cover letter and CV. Applications close on 18 October 2020. Emails will be electronically acknowledged and further correspondence may be by email.

To view the Candidate Briefing Information please click here.

For more information please phone Mike Stenhouse on +64 274 428 348.

To apply use application form or email cvchc@sheffield.co.nz

name: General Manager Commercial
description:
THE COMPANY

Our client, Shoof International is a developer, manufacturer, importer, exporter, and marketer of veterinary and animal breeding equipment. Shoof Head Office is in Cambridge, New Zealand, with wholly owned subsidiary companies in Melbourne, Australia, and Osorno, Chile. They have a long and successful history and are proud to be a global innovation-led company.

THE CULTURE

Shoof have an innovative culture; their people and ideas are key to their success. They actively foster a culture where creativity thrives. Contributing to this is a commitment to research and development, a workplace environment that allows their people to imagine innovative ideas to solve customer challenges, and a senior management team that supports turning those ideas into reality.

THE ROLE

Reporting to the CEO, the General Manager – Commercial is their custodian of performance. Shoof operates in a multi-market environment, which means they must be across the numbers, constantly looking forward and reporting to ensure they are continually enhancing the position of the business. Most importantly they need to drive decisions, based on analytics / insights and reviewing ongoing performance, which enables growth. You are not necessarily a CA, however, you need to be across the numbers in detail, understand FX trading and be able to deliver on proactive commercial management to drive results.

Shoof has a firm belief that the quality of their leaders has the biggest impact on their work environment and business outcomes, therefore a focus on strategic leadership of your team and across the business will be a critical focus of the role. Your responsibilities will include commercial management, finance management, IT and support services, new ventures, business intelligence reporting, business risk / recovery management whilst delivering on projects that continually enhance the position of the business.

THE PERSON

To be successful, you will need to:

  • Be an expert in the numbers (P & L, Balance Sheet, FX, Margin / Profit Realisation)
  • Have a background in commercial management / finance
  • Believe in opportunity, accountability and driving change
  • Be approachable and empathetic
  • Have a robust understanding of finance fundamentals and how to translate into proactive commercial management
  • Be highly competent across ERP systems and Microsoft Office suite (particularly Excel)
  • Embrace diversity / change management
  • Work well at all organisational levels

In addition you will possess:

  • 5+ years’ leadership experience as a Senior Commercial Management professional
  • A proven track record in commercial management
  • Experience in SME Business Environment
  • A tertiary qualification in Business, Finance, Accounting, or a related field

In return, you will be part of a collaborative leadership team that drives strategy throughout the business. The role attracts an excellent remuneration package and is an opportunity for an energetic and strategic leader to make a considerable impact on the business.

For a confidential discussion about the role, please contact Sandra Diekerhof, Director, HR Connect Ltd on 027 52 666 99.

You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for this job.

Find out more about our innovative company at www.shoof.co.nz

name: Technology Senior Business Analyst
description:
Requisition Title -
Technology Senior Business Analyst

Job Number: - NEW042209

Description
  • Open Banking is an exciting opportunity to work with a broad range of internal, 3rd party and external stakeholders to create new customer propositions and capabilities
  • Solving new and interesting problems at scale by shaping a high performing culture that will set up the team for success

About The Role
As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering business analysis across medium to high complexity initiatives that delivers value to our Customers. As part of the Open Banking Programme there is potential to revolutionise the financial sector and be part of a team to drive transformation and innovation.

To achieve this, you will:
  • Apply your business analysis skills and techniques to understand, validate and articulate business problems, opportunities, requirements, options and solutions.

  • Strong communication and influencing skills at all levels.
  • Join a fantastic team that is consistently growing and changing, and who will truly value the role you play.

Role Type: Permanent, full-time opportunity

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

name: Software Developer - Local Government
description:
Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The Developer role is responsible for the core coded business logic for the developed application or platform. It will be their job to understand the business requirements for a feature or component of the application or platform and deliver the code to fulfil those requirements.
A developer should be intimately familiar with the languages and design patterns used in the application and strive to deliver code that is well structured and maintainable.
They will be responsible for working with the relevant domain team members to ensure that all solutions are developed/coded and configured (including reporting) to ensure that the solution achieves the intended business requirements.
What you’ll bring
  • Strong C#, .Net Core, MS SQL, React, Rest Api’s, MVC skills
  • Devexpress, SpecFlow, xUnit would also be great to have
  • It is of further benefit for those applicants who have previously worked with ERP’s or CRM’s. eg: SAP, Dynamics
  • An ability to quickly and clearly understand new development requirements
  • Strong communication skills are a must as the role will involve dealing with multiple stakeholders
Responsibilities
  • Providing input into the feature design stage, estimation and sprint planning
  • Work with Product Manager, BA, Dev Lead, and domain team to design and deliver customer outcomes
  • Understand the business domain at a high level, and understand the feature & functions you are working on at a detailed level
  • Work with QA to design and run key functional tests as part of development activity
  • Work with the Business Analyst to resolve gaps or ambiguities in the functional design
  • Document the development done, including testing performed and any areas of risk or requiring QA focus
  • Develop code in a clear, maintainable way with a focus on ease of use & performance.
  • Be familiar with development frameworks and platform capabilities and use established, common design patterns. Develop for re-use wherever possible
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

name: UX/UI Designer - Wellington or Christchurch based opportunit...
description:
UX/UI Designer - Wellington or Christchurch based opportunity


Kaihoahoa UX/UI [Wheako kaiwhakamahi/Atanga kaiwhakamahi]

About Us | Mō mātou

At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.

The role | Mō te tūnga

As part of the Customer Experience unit, the UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing UX/UI skills to ensure we understand the customer during the process of product development (e.g. website, data tools). You will be working with Senior UX/UI designers, content designers and a product owner who have a strong focus on making things easier for our customers.

The UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing a solid understanding of the customer through research and testing products. With an increasing demand from our customers to improve the way we deliver our products, the UX/UI Designer will provide key evidence to support decision-making during the product development process. The UX/UI designer will help build relationships across the organisation.

This is a very exciting time to be joining our team and be part of wider changes within the organisation. No two days will be the same in this influential and critical role in better understanding customer needs.

Focusing on development projects and shaping methods that will ensure a better customer experience, the UX/UI Designer will:

  • work closely with Customer Experience teams to support a range of initiatives
  • provide expertise on projects that will improve our products for our customers
  • assist with customer testing and research that will be the source of truth for best practice across the organisation
  • be the voice of external customers and work alongside others within the organisation to create success in what we deliver
  • engage with customers to understand their needs and requirements
  • embrace opportunities to work with other parts of the organisation, seeking opportunities to embed UX best practice
  • work closely with other relevant UX experts across government to foster collaboration and governance

Starting salary: $63,000 - $71,000 negotiable depending on the skills and experience of the successful applicant.

About you | Mōu

To succeed in this role, you will:

  • be familiar with research methods using a variety of user research and testing methods to reveal customer insights
  • have a good understanding of product development and user testing methodologies
  • have great communication and relationship management skills – with both working with customers and influencing stakeholders
  • be able to maintain a strong customer focus and understanding to inform development
  • share learnings and developing best practice to support the organisation
  • work in an agile development environment with analysts, designers, developers, and software teams to create customer-focused products and services.

Desired skills:

  • Have experience working in service design and/or working in a service design environment
  • Ability to work proactively within a team environment and take on new challenges with ease
  • Ability to help build consensus and facilitate discussions

How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono

If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/3kxGzfI into your browser.

Any questions that haven’t been answered in this advert or the position description or if you have difficulty with your application please email jobs@stats.govt.nz.

We will be screening applications as we receive them in order to move swiftly to interview shortly after the advert closes on date. Note to Recruitment Agencies: unsolicited CVs will not be accepted.

You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job.

Applications close Thursday 8 October 2020.

name: Senior & Principal Recruiters
description:
At Talent Army we work with tech start-ups, agencies and growing companies that are scaling and help them find awesome people to help them scale.

We've just turned FIVE and since Talent Army was founded the team has been growing VERY fast. We have offices in Wellington and Auckland and work in Australia and the United States.

Crazily, we are yet to make a single sales call at all and every day we get approached by amazing new clients that keep referring new companies to us.

This means we need Senior & Principal recruiters based in Wellington to help 'US' scale too.

A bit about us.

We tend not to take ourselves too seriously and threw out all our suits and business attire and now 'wear whatever we want!' We are proactive in the way we source people (LinkedIn, Github, Meetups, Chrome extensions, and any tool that helps us reach good tech candidates!) If you don't know how to use these we can teach you.

We're informal, honest, and collaborative with clients, candidates, and between our team.

What we care about the most is to provide excellent 'no bullsh*t service to our clients and help lift the profile of the recruitment industry.

We also operate a 4-day work week and you get paid the 5 days.

On top of all the above; we pay well, pay commission, have a conference budget, and do a lot of cool things as a team. For example: At the end of every month we have #TalentArmyAFK (Talent Army Away from Keyboard) where we get out of the office for the day and do something fun. The last two months we did axe throwing and how to make a barista coffee from our machine.

We also have a private island holiday in Fiji booked when Covid allows us.

Our clients trust us as their recruitment team and work exclusively with us. This makes a huge difference and we have clients that give us keys to their office, let us use their email domain and truly treat us as an employee or a partner.

We like sharing what we know, as we like learning new stuff. Be it a new recruitment tool or the last trends in the tech world. We quite like attending tech and recruitment conferences too and can usually be found at most of them.

Last but not least...have a look at Talent Army website to see if you share our vision of how recruitment should be like!

Don't come here if you want a boring easy throw an ad up online and send the 3 best candidates that apply. We tend to operate faster and deal directly with founders and managers.

Do come here if you have the below:

What you will do:
  • Build really good relationships with your clients - you'll be talking directly to start ups founders, and giving them advice as well as candidates! Sometimes we even work onsite to really understand the work they are doing.
  • Source good developers, digital designers, testers, project managers, development managers, product managers, tech leads and all-round great tech people, both in NZ and worldwide.
  • Keep on learning about the IT & Recruitment trends (Meetups and conferences are always welcome).
  • Work collaboratively and dynamically within the team.
  • Be yourself. No need to dress up (unless you want to!). If you don't know something, just ask. If you know a better way to do things, share it with us. If you don't like beer/wine, just ask for your sugar-free almond milk (but if you do like beer/wine, you'll always find some in the fridge!).
  • Share your knowledge - we're all about sharing our strengths, and growing as a team.
What skills & experience are we looking for?
  • Someone who loves getting to know their clients, and is really able to understand their needs.
  • Sound experience across Account Management and sourcing, be as an agency or internal recruiter. What matters here is that you know how things work so you will be able to manage your time strategically.
  • Experience within the tech industry. IT has its own rules and requires us to do our homework to be successful. We're often reading blogs and attending tech conferences.
  • Team player, proactive, passionate.

I love a good cover letter and so tell me what you can achieve here in 4 days and what you will want to do on your paid day off.

name: Inter/Senior Quantity Surveyor - (Contract 4-6months)
description:
• Excellent local developer
  • Impressive projects in Auckland - Christchurch
  • Secure work flow and attractive packages available

Construction and Technical Recruitment (CTR) are working with a New Zealand owned developer, with a solid work flow ahead for 2021 and beyond. Due to the pipeline of work they have been developing, they are looking for a senior level quantity surveyor to join the team and support the commercial function of the business.

CTR are working with a developer that has secure funding and a great history of local projects, from Auckland to Christchurch. The type of projects you will be working on are well-respected and focus on industrial work and mid-rise Residential/Retirement new build projects.

They are focused on delivering a top level product to their clients through their organisational management and structured systems. The company works with high performing construction teams who are committed to delivering projects to the highest standards.

The company believe their success lies within their core talent and selection of high performing and experienced construction professionals who have successfully managed and delivered great projects. Now is your chance to join the team and help take things to another level.

We are looking for a Quantity Surveyor with these skills -
  • 8 years+ NZ local experience with a related qualification.
  • Solid knowledge of Payment claims & Variations
  • Pre and Post contract negotiation
  • Feasibility analysis, tender documentation and bill of quantities
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • New build construction knowledge
  • Passion for construction and a high work ethic with attention to detail
This is an excellent opportunity and could get your career moving again in 2020 and ready for a busy 2021. The role will initially be a contract role, but with the work flow ahead, I'm confident this will develop into a full time position.
Interviews will take place from 5th October

For more details and a confidential conversation, please contact Nick Gillingham - nickgillingham@ctrecruitment.co.nz

To be considered for this role, you MUST be able to work in New Zealand.

name: Intermediate Quantity Surveyor
description:
Your New company You will be working for one of NZ’s best residential developers based in South Auckland! Due to a high demand for both private and social housing, they are looking for a driven Intermediate QS to assist on delivering a new 4+ year largescale housing development on a temp to perm basis. If you are looking for stability, career progression and very competitive renumeration, then this could be the ideal opportunity for you!What you will need to succeed You will ideally have Quantity Surveying experience preferably with a housing contractor in New Zealand. Your role as Quantity Surveyor will rely heavily on having a strong understanding of the tendering/contracts process, positive communication with subcontractors and your ability to work well as a team.

You will be working closely with a highly experienced Senior QS to fulfil the below roles: -Pre-contract tendering pricing/estimating -Formulating tender documents, including tags list etc -Cost provision budgeting and control -Cost and back cost reporting -Progress claims managementWhat you will get in return You will be provided with a very competitive salary and benefits, working with a stable company that takes great pride in supporting it’s employees. What you need to do now! Please contact Kevin on: +64 27 528 4536 / Kevin@buildingrecruitment.co.nz for a confidential discussion about the role and your situation. If this role isn’t ideal for you, we specialise in finding the best talent within construction and matching them with the right role and are more than happy to discuss other opportunities.

name: Commercial Property Lawyer | Senior Solicitor
description:
Our client is an established law firm who are well known for building trusting client relationships while delivering personalised legal advice. They have a solid commercial property team that works with a range of clients such as public sector entities, developers, investors and various businesses in the private sector.

Working with a supportive partner who has extensive experience in this sector, you will gain experience in a range of matters across the commercial property spectrum including acquisitions and disposals of buildings, development projects for master-planned communities, advising on complex commercial leasing arrangements and large property subdivisions. The firm is known to treat its staff well and there is collegiality with other juniors and seniors as part of the team as well.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • 4+ years' experience in the property field.
  • Some experience in commercial property transactional property work and an interest in developing your career in complex and high-end development work as well.
  • A good academic record.

This is a great opportunity to advance your career with a firm that offers an interesting mix of commercial property work while being mentored by the best.

For further information, contact Harrison on 027 2745 926 or email your CV and academic record by clicking 'APPLY' now.

Thinking of relocating? Cobalt Recruitment has opportunities all across New Zealand, so if you are looking to move to another region or return from overseas, Cobalt is perfectly positioned to help you with your transition.
